additionalHouseRules:
No refunds for weather related issues.  This includes lack of snow.
$5 per key cash deposit & $45 gate remote deposit where applicable
 Chains, snow tires, or 4-wheel drive mandatory during ice or snow

This is a vacation rental agreement under the North Carolina Vacation Rental Act.  The rights and obligations of the parties to this agreement are defined by law and include unique provisions permitting the disbursement of rent prior to tenancy and expedited eviction of tenants.  Your signature on this agreement, or payment of money, or taking possession of the property after receipt of this agreement, is evidence of your acceptance of the agreement and your intent to use this property for a vacation rental.  Rentals exceeding 90 days do not fall under the NC vacation rental management act and are not subject to the same protections adhered to by the NC Vacation Rental Management Act.

Maximum occupancy must be strictly adhered to.  Occupancy count includes children.  Exceeding the occupancy limit set for your unit is ground for immediate eviction.  No exceptions and no refunds!

Accidental Damage Protector & Security Deposits:  The Accidental Damage Protection Plan is included in the advertised total amount and indemnifies you and your family up to $1500 for any accidental damage during your stay. All accidental damage must be reported to our office in writing by the end of renter’s stay in order for Damage Protector to apply.  Damage Protector is a surety contract and is not insurance.  RRR is not an insurer, insurance agent or underwriter.  The Accidental Damage Protection is non refundable.  Damage Protector does NOT cover intentional damage, excessive cleaning, theft, Acts of God, gross negligence, pet damage, utilities, rent, pay for view cable charges, additional costs incurred during stay per renter’s request, or loss of use.  Any intentional property damage or items listed above will be billed to the renter and may be charged to renter’s account or credit card on file without renter’s consent if RRR is unable to contact renter to request authorization.  

A security deposit can be elected in lieu of Accidental Damage Protection.  The cost ranges from $200 to $800 depending on the rental unit.  It is fully refundable by mail within 30 days of departure providing no damages have been made to the unit and the unit has been left tidy (according to our check out procedures) or (less any allowable deductions).  The security deposit can be paid in advance by personal check, money order, certified funds or credit card. Security deposits paid upon arrival must be paid by cash or credit card only. 

A few homes may require an additional security deposit beyond what is required above in this rental agreement.  The renter agrees to reimburse the homeowner for any damages to the property caused by renter that are in excess of, or not covered by Damage Protector or the security deposit.  Such damages shall include reasonable attorney fees and court costs.  The provisions of Article 5, Chapter 42A of the North Carolina General Statutes (Landlord and tenant Duties) are incorporated herein by reference as if fully set forth.

The renter fully understands that RRR is a rental agency engaging in the rental of private property of others.  RRR reserves the right to refuse service to anyone RRR feels will not be responsible for the property he/she is renting. RRR does not rent to anyone under the age of 21.  Each rental unit requires a person 21 or older to rent and sign the rental contract.  This person must be present at check-in and for duration of rental.  Renter understands that RRR has the right to terminate this agreement, re-enter the unit, or take necessary measures to remove the renter from the premises in the event renter and guests violates the conditions of this agreement.  RRR is not responsible for the loss or theft of clothing, money, jewelry, etc. and is not be held liable for any accidents or injury of any nature.  RRR reserves the right to move any reservation that might come about due to unforeseen circumstances (house sold, out of rental program, owner’s use, act of God, etc.)  Under no circumstances is the obligation of RRR more than that of refunding the renter’s deposit. Rates are subject to all applicable taxes.  Rates are subject to change with notice.

Accommodations: All of our vacation properties are individually owned and reflect each owner’s taste.  Rearranging of furniture is not permitted. If you have specific standards or requirements for your vacation residence we advise personal inspection of the property prior to making reservations. Burning wood in any gas fireplace is prohibited and subject to forfeiture of security deposit.  Grilling is not permitted on any porches, decks or walkways.  All units are provided with enough garbage bags, paper towels, dishwashing detergent, bath soap, and toilet paper to get you started.  If you need more of these items, you can purchase them at Food Lion located on Tynecastle Hwy or other local grocery stores.  Firewood is NOT provided.  Propane/grill accessories are NOT provided. A one-time linen fee is charged on all units.  Linens are provided with initial set-up.  Additional linens/towels are not provided.  Towels for pools and/or hot tubs are not provided. There is a fee for extras and exchanges.

Renter agrees to indemnify and hold harmless RRR and the owner from and against any liability for personal injury or property damage sustained by any person (including renter’s guests) as a result of any cause, unless caused by the negligent or willful act of RRR or the owner, or the failure of the RRR or the owner to comply with the Vacation Rental Act.  Renter agrees that RRR, the owner or their respective representatives may enter the premises during reasonable hours to inspect the premises, to make such repairs, alterations or improvements thereto as RRR or owner may deem appropriate, or to show the premises to perspective purchasers or renters.

RRR does not guarantee any weather, road or ski conditions and there will be no refund as a result of either.  Transportation is the sole responsibility of the renter.  Snow tires, chains or 4-wheel drive is mandatory during adverse weather as stated by Sugar Mountain law.

There will be no refund for weather related issues.  This includes but is not limited to lack of snow or inclement weather preventing the renters’ arrival.  We strongly recommend accepting the travel insurance to assist with obtaining refunds for these situations. No refunds are made for early departures or no shows.

Travel Insurance: We offer travel insurance through Red Sky Travel Insurance.  This provides coverage should you need to cancel or interrupt your trip as well as primary medical coverage, coverage for lack to snow and much more.  Please read your “Description of Coverage” for details.  If no computer access, please ask us to send you a copy of the Insurance Policy. Insurance premiums are non-refundable.

Check-in: Check in starts at 4:00 pm. RRR does not guarantee check-in time. Check in at our office.  No early check-ins are guaranteed.  Renters are not permitted to enter the unit without first coming to the office and checking in.  No entry is allowed until units are cleaned and inspected.  There is a refundable $5.00 per key deposit (cash only) due at check-in.  There is also a refundable $45.00 deposit on community gate remotes where applicable (cash or credit card only).  Our office hours are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and 5 p.m. on Saturdays with extended hours during ski season (including Sundays).  If you will be arriving after regular office hours there will be a late arrival packet left for you in the green “Check-in” box at the front of our office.  This is provided if you have paid in full and have a signed contract.  The packet will have your name on the front and inside you will find a map to the unit(s), one key, and emergency phone numbers in case of a problem.  NO arrivals on Thanksgiving or Christmas Day as our offices are closed.  Upon check in, if you have any housekeeping issues or other issues related to the comfort of your stay, please contact our office immediately to report specifics.  There will be no refunds upon checkout for issues that were never reported immediately upon check-in or during your stay.

Check-out:  10:00 a.m. All units must be vacated by 10:00 a.m. on the scheduled departure date and keys returned to office unless PRIOR arrangements have been made for late check-out.  Failure to check out on time will result in a $50 late check-out fee.  Failure to comply with check out procedures listed below will result in additional charges.

Before checking out please do the following steps:
Tidy Unit
Load and start dishwasher
Clean out refrigerator – do not leave any food in kitchen
Take out all trash to appropriate receptacles (trash MUST be bagged)
Turn off all lights
Unplug small appliances
Turn thermostats (heat) back to 55 degrees in winter
Lock and secure all windows and doors

Ordinances: 
Most properties limit number of vehicles and parking spaces.  Parking is not permitted on town streets.  Renter is responsible for any fees incurred due to parking in prohibited areas.  No oversized vehicles are allowed in parking areas without prior permission from RRR.  Buses and oversized vehicles are prohibited on the mountain except in designated areas. 
Town ordinance prohibits loose dogs on the mountain.  All dogs must be kept on a leash.
Quiet Hours are from 11 p.m. to  8 a.m. on Sugar Mountain.  After one notice, if tenant fails to adhere to this regulation it will result in an immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid

Daily Maid Service: is not provided.  We can, however, arrange extra cleaning services for you at an additional charge. Must have 48 hours advance notice.

Lock Out Policy: During office hours you may pick up an extra key at our office.  After hours, one of our agents will meet you at the office.  There is a $25 charge for this service.

Locked Closets:  Most units have one or more locked closets which are not available to guests.  These doors are checked behind each guest.  Tenant will be responsible for any damage or missing items.  Criminal charges could result.

Repairs and Service Calls: Please report any inoperative equipment to our office promptly.  We cannot guarantee appliances, TV’s, heaters, gas logs, cable or internet, etc. and no refund or rate adjustments will be made for any mechanical failure including power outages.  We do not refund for malfunctioning hot tubs. We will, however, make every effort to have repairs done quickly or reasonably remedy the problem.

Telephones: Most units have telephones.  Some are set up for 911 services only.  Please charge all long distance calls to your credit card, calling card, or home phone.  There will be an additional $10.00 service charge on any calls charged to the unit phone number.  Local prefixes 898, 733, 737, 387 and 964 only.  All others are long distance including Foscoe, Boone and Blowing Rock.

Pets:  Absolutely NO pets are allowed unless otherwise permitted by RRR.  You must call for permission.  A pet deposit of $100 per pet is mandatory and is not refundable. Breach of this policy will result in immediate eviction and loss of monies.  No pets are allowed between December 1st and March 15th. 

Smoking: Absolutely no smoking in units.  Failure to adhere will result a fumigation charge and immediate eviction.

Waiver of Liability for Spa, Hot Tub, Jacuzzi, Sauna and Pool: The renter understands that there are special risks involved in the use of above special features.  Renter is aware there are potential dangers these features may present to children and adults that are not carefully supervised, as well as any person using special feature too long or if a person has health risks or is intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or pregnant.  Renter agrees to waive any claim whatsoever against RRR and owner of property for accidents or injury arising from use of special features.  The renter agrees he/she is responsible and liable for any damages that occur to the special feature through his or his guest’s misuse or negligence.  If a hot tub has to be drained and refilled due to foreign substances in the water, there will be an extra charge to the renter for this service and it will be charged to renter’s account or credit card.

Units listed for Sale: Renter agrees to allow unit to be shown promptly.  24 hour notice will be given.

Property Transfer: In the event the Owner transfers this property prior to occupancy by renter, renter has the right to enforce this agreement if the rental is to end 180 days or less after the transfer of ownership.  If more than the above 180 days, renter has no enforcement rights unless the Grantee agrees to honor this rental; however, renter has a right to a refund of all monies paid.  RRR will promptly notify renter if property is transferred.

Mail: We do not accept mail for renters renting less than one month.  If renting for a month or more mail may be forwarded to our office. Mail will be picked up daily and will be available at our office after 2 p.m. if possible.  RRR is not personally responsible or liable for any lost or damaged mail.

Illegal Acts: Absolutely no acts illegal by law are allowed in RRR units or on premises.  Any such action will result in immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid.  Any excessive cleaning or damage caused by these acts will be charged to the renter.

primaryHost/about:
We are a premier vacation rental management company located in Sugar Mountain, NC near the Blue Ridge Parkway and Grandfather Mountain. Currently we manage over 150 properties varying from Cabins, Mountain Homes, Chalets and Condos.  Once a reservation is made, our reservationists will contact you via email, with a Rental Agreement. All guests must sign and return a Rental Agreement within 7 days to guarantee your reservation.
YOU MUST Check-IN and Check-OUT at 3390 Tynecastle Highway,  Sugar Mountain NC 28604. DO NOT go directly to your rental location.
You will receive a welcome pack containing a Guest Guide, map and Keys to your vacation rental.
ITS SWEETER UP HERE!
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. There is a convenient trail across the parking lot from the condo that leads to the ski slopes. The walk is 300 yards or less.  Great for ski access or mountain biking without having to endure parking hassles.  Not only are you a stones throw from all the amenities that Sugar Mountain has to offer, you are only a short drive from Banner Elk, Boone and Blowing Rock which offers the best in dining, shopping, golf and outdoor activities. Relax in the comfortable living room with a stone gas fireplace and large flat screen smart TV. The master bedroom features a king size bed and private bath with Jacuzzi tub and walk in shower.  The guest room features a queen bed with adjoining bath. There is also a queen sleeper sofa. Enjoy cooking in the fully furnished gourmet kitchen with all stainless steel appliances. Wi-Fi is provided.No Smoking  *ONLY TWO(2) PARKING PERMITS PER UNIT. VEHICLES WITHOUT PERMITS WILL BE TOWED AT THE OWNER'S EXPENSE* Absolutely NO Pets.  Max occupancy is 4. 4x4/awd, chains or snow tires needed in winter. No Check-in's Thanksgiving Day or Christmas Day. All guests required to sign rental agreement upon booking.

primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.

Surrounded by mountains and located right around the corner from the Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trailhead office.
Enjoy High Rocks, Wilmore Dam or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, hiking or boating. 
Easy access to restaurants, gas station, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and House is located in quiet friendly neighborhood with plenty of parking.

sectionedDescription/access: Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...
Surrounded by mountains and located just a stones throw away (1/4 mile) from Hatfield McCoy's trail head Warrior and many outlaw trails. Enjoy High Rocks and Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking.
Easy access to restaurants, gas, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and house is located in a friendly Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking.

The house features 2 bedroom, 2 bath full house that sleeps 8 comfortable. Living room, eat in kitchen and laundry area. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster anything you need. 
Fully equipped with towels, and clean linens are on all the beds. Also a wonderful porch with table, chairs and a propane grill to enjoy the outdoors.
The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bath between the two bedrooms. 
Living room has a flat screen TV with a fire stick and WIFI.
Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.
This house has a suite ( duplex) that can be rented for larger groups.

Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.

Our mission is to make your stay at The Calvary House as enjoyable as possible. 
 We are locally owned and located directly accross the street up on the hill if you need anything. 

 We respect your privacy . We'll give you the space that you want or the help you may need.

We are located around the corner from Warrior Trailhead office. Warrior Trail has direct connections to Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge and Pocahontas Trail. 
Located off RT 16 part of the 91 mile Head of the Dragon Motorcycle Ride in McDowell County. Surrounded by beautiful scenery.
 
Quiet Neighborhood in a welcoming small town with all the conveniences.  Restaurants, Grocery Store and gas station and car wash.

War is an ATV friendly town as well as the surrounding communities. 
You can ride in town and directly to the Trailhead.

Day Trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

** Check out our other Listings**
Calvary Suite
The Cove House
Cove Suite

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Please load dishwasher before checking out. Sit full trash bags outside the downstairs entry door for pickup.

sectionedDescription/description:
Rustic Cabin with great views, amenities,plenty of parking for trailers and Atvs with easy access to Hatfield and Mccoy trails....Indian Ridge, Pinnacle and Pocahontas Trail Systems. Perfect location for anyone wanting to ride trails or simply relax and get away. From the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Rustic cabin absolute perfect spot to relax and unwind after a long day riding the trails. Amazing waterfall  views while grilling on your Blackstone out back back. Have a cup a coffee from the Keurig on the back porch to get the day going!!

Mountain Views, quiet are, little traffic. Many opportunities to ride Atvs

primaryHost/about:
This is the home we grew up in a small town in southern WV with our parents and grandparents living across the road.  Our family wants to keep our childhood home that holds many memories of grandparents, friends, family, and neighbors as well as our children who grew to love the area.  That was the deciding decision for hosting the airbnb with brothers - Jamie and Troy with help from everyone else.

I am a retired art teacher from Taylor County WV and Lexington Senior High NC. I live in Thomasville NC with my husband who is also from McDowell County WV.  Besides art, I sew and have an online etsy shop.  My brother Troy, has a house-painting business and lives near Bluefield Va.  Our sister Ann, retired from teaching music and her husband have lived in many areas; they are now retired living in White Sulphur Springs WV.  Jamie, my youngest sibling, is a visual artist and works with Urban Tree in Pittsburgh Pa (unique wood furniture).
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music
sectionedDescription/description:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie

- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.

If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music

There is a local contact name (Cindy) on the buffet should guests need anything immediately or call me and I will contact her.

Private setting with the woods behind you and beside you.  Pond on the lower lot with the fire pit.  One neighbor across the street.

The Warrior Trail is 10 miles from our house, parking is at the Trailhead office through the town of War (about another mile from the trail entrance.  The outlaw trails do not show up on the trail maps, we drew one to leave at the house for New Haven Road (hopefully the last riders left it). The other access is below Cucumber and called Big Creek Mountain Road. New Haven Rd is around 4 miles from our lodge, maybe 1/4 from the store and Big Creek Mountain Rd is another couple miles.  I've been told this is the map that will show you all trails...search bob t maps

Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

---Guests will be provided blankets/quilts, pillows, and kitchen towels.  Guests will provide their own sheets and bath towels.  Dish detergent, hand soaps, paper towels, bathroom tissue, and hand sanitizer are provided.
---its actually a 3BR home but one is presently locked for family storage and the den has an accordion door to give privacy as a 3rd bedroom
---Plenty of downed wood to be found for the firepit, might want to bring an ax or saw
---Hunters - if you’re coming during hunting seasons - there are 2 gun racks on the walls for your convenience
---Den area:  - there’s a daybed that sleeps one, a monitor that could be used with your device; there’s a few books and games
---The sofas both have pull-out beds, the love seat is more comfortable than the full but kids don't seem to notice.  The queen air mattress does fit in the den floor on the desk side
---Great views for artists and the all-purpose room would be a great place for painting - lots of windows
---Writers would enjoy the pace and quiet

-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.
sectionedDescription/summary:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie
sectionedDescription/transit:
Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #8 - The Colonel May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Shared Bathroom)

The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #7 - The Nelle May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #7 - The Nelle May Room (Shared Bathroom)

A room just as stunning as Andrew Jackson May’s second wife (who was 51 years his junior), the Nelle May room is a picturesque part of the mansion and is quickly becoming a guest favorite for it’s good vibes, early morning sunshine, happy wall coloring and vintage white painted bed. This expansive, bright, and cheerful bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace and also has a cozy sitting area. It is a perfect room for folks looking for a recharging environment.

name: Storybook Cottage with a View
photos/0/caption: View of the garden at the end of July- gourds and zinnias are growing!
photos/1/caption: An aerial view of the Storybook Cottage--- above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/2/caption: Above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/3/caption: Another view of the cottage- there is a seating area in front the cottage (in addition to the private back deck.)
photos/4/caption: View of the cottage garden - mid-July. Cucumbers are ready and tomatoes are green. Radishes have been canned, wind-fallen apple jelly has been made, and zucchini bread is being baked! Yum!
photos/5/caption: This is a view of the fire pit and the barn.  In the far left of the picture, you can see our largest grape arbor (muscadine grapes.)  We also have concord grapes here.
photos/6/caption: Looking through the front entrance to the cottage, into the cottage garden.  This is taken at the end of July- the gourds are growing well,  in addition to the morning glories and moon flowers!
photos/7/caption: Aerial view of the cottage. The pond is visible in the rear and there is a seating area in front of the cottage as well.
photos/8/caption: This is the "mudroom" - a place to unpack and take off your shoes.
photos/9/caption: This is the bedroom-- the view immediately as walking in from the mudroom.
photos/10/caption: This is a view of the kitchenette from inside the bedroom.
photos/11/caption: This is an antique dresser which converts to a lighted desk space.
photos/12/caption: This is a view of the kitchenette from inside the bedroom.
photos/13/caption: The bedroom is equipped with a television and dvd player.
photos/14/caption: This is a view of the bedroom from inside the kitchenette.
photos/15/caption: This is a view of the bedroom from inside the kitchenette.
photos/16/caption: This is the view of the pond from the bedroom.  There are sheers and room darkening panels as well.
photos/17/caption: A view from the bedroom looking out over the pond.  This door accesses your private deck.

photos/24/caption: In the bathroom, you'll find a stocked travel case of toiletries, as well as towels, wash clothes, hand towels, and a hair dryer.

photos/26/caption: View of the back entrance into the cottage.  This entrance is adjacent to the dedicated parking for the cottage- so it's the most convenient.
photos/27/caption: 123 Whimsy Way is your address at the Holliday Castle.

photos/29/caption: Nasturtiums are growing in the hanging basket on the back porch overlooking the pond. (Leaves are slightly peppery and similar to watercress in flavor.)
photos/30/caption: These are the ducks.  They have a terrific sense of humor. :-)
photos/31/caption: These are the chickens. (They're smiling - honest.)
photos/32/caption: On the right is the corner of our house, the gray building is our garage and there is a sitting area inside the stone wall- excellent for breakfast or relaxing during the evening.
photos/33/caption: Excellent picnic spot near the pond.
photos/34/caption: Excellent picnic spot near the pond.
photos/35/caption: Trail circles the pond and provides access to an excellent picnic spot.
photos/36/caption: Ishmael's Tackle Shop is located beneath the cottage. Just open the door to find all kinds of fishing supplies, as well as chairs to use.
photos/38/caption: A pear tree is growing to the left of the cottage. We can pears and make pear butter in the late summer/early fall. Delicious!
photos/39/caption: The Storybook Cottage does not have a key box or a code for entrance.  Instead, skeleton keys are used for every door.
photos/40/caption: Geraniums are growing in pots on the table.  Basil is growing in the planter on the porch.
photos/41/caption: Sunflowers are in bloom, alongside tomatoes and a baby grape vine, in the front yard at the Holliday Castle!
photos/42/caption: Access to a sitting area in front of the Cottage
photos/43/caption: View in October from the front porch of the Cottage.  This is the Cottage Garden.

photos/50/caption: View from the mudroom looking into the bedroom.
photos/51/caption: Tiny Christmas tree in the mudroom and a basket of books and games.
photos/52/caption: Soldier standing guard at the Cottage!
photos/58/caption: Awesome view of the pond in December!
photos/61/caption: Our pet turkey, Pumpkin. He's a sweetie!
photos/63/caption: This is the view from the cottage porch (Pumpkin, the turkey, is hanging out!)
photos/65/caption: This is Jack sitting on the edge of the fire pit looking at the back of the cottage.
photos/66/caption: Duck peeking over the cottage garden wall.
photos/69/caption: King Arthur, the peacock, was raised here. However, he has now moved to a farm with two female peacocks.
photos/74/caption: Our first Granny Smith apple on the dwarf tree in the cottage garden.  August 2021.

primaryHost/about: I'm a mom of 6 and stay home with our two youngest boys (who are 5 and 8.)  I love to garden, cook, can, sew, play the piano, read non-fiction, write, create and dream.  I have authored two books, "Fairly-Popular Fairy Tales and Classic Cookery" and "The Dandelion King."  I enjoy taking care of our animals (dog, cats, ducks, chickens, and turkey)  My husband and I are converting our 2 bedroom, 1940s house, into a castle. (I draw and he builds.)  We also design and build quirky playhouses and enjoy taking amazing road trips with our kids. Oh- and I collect pencils. :-)
sectionedDescription/access:
The entire Cottage is for your use.  

Rental of the cottage includes a souvenir fishing permit.  This will give you complete access to the fishing supplies in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we'll have it unlocked for you.  We do require that after any photographs, you throw your fish back in the pond. (Swimming is not allowed in the pond.) (Ice skating on the pond is also not allowed.)

We are currently building a pencil museum for Jill's collection.  The pencil museum opens up to our Blackberry Boardwalk.  It's a nice walkway through the edge of the woods near the pond.  It also helps make the blackberries more accessible during season (they're typically ripe in August and you're welcome to help yourself!) Although the museum is still in a construction phase, the Blackberry Boardwalk is complete.

Also, we are located in a very popular area for ATV riders.  We are 38.8 miles to the Pocahontas Trail Head (Hatfield & McCoy ATV & UTV Trails).  You are welcome to use any tools in our garage for maintenance of your ATV or UTV while you are visiting. 

You're free to walk throughout the property, including the gardens.  Please also treat the gardens like a buffet.  You're welcome to eat all of the vegetables and fruit you want while you're here.  You're also welcome to help with any animal chores and gardening (especially fun for kids!) and we love to answer any questions you have.

When it is time for your check-out, you can just walk away!  No cleaning or locking up needed.  We like for folks to be able to completely relax and not worry about any of the details. :-)
sectionedDescription/description:
Stay in the Storybook Cottage at the Holliday Castle!  The Storybook Cottage is a tiny crooked fairytale house located behind our home (which is being converted into a castle!)  Enjoy the view from your private back porch! Close to ski resort!

The Storybook Cottage is a fairytale-inspired tiny crooked house.  The Cottage is located directly behind our house - which is in the process of being converted into a castle. Our property houses apple trees, plum trees, cherry trees, grapevines, peach trees, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, and pear trees- in addition to mass quantities of vegetables. 

In the photographs posted, you'll be able to see more about the property, the placement of the Cottage in relation to the main house, and some of the animals. :-)

In the Cottage, you'll find books, board games, and general whimsy. During the late spring and summer, the front porch opens up into an edible front yard- feel free to help yourself!  The back porch overlooks the pond (beautiful, but not suitable for skating!).  Rental of the cottage comes with access to the fishing supplies located in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we keep it unlocked for our guests.  (However, swimming is not allowed in the pond- and when it's frozen over, no skating is allowed either.)

The Cottage is a tiny house, yet still has a lot of amenities!  You have your own private kitchenette, equipped with a sink, mini-fridge, breakfast station (which includes a coffee pot, toaster oven and griddle), a microwave and a table with seats for two.  (Due to the size of this kitchenette, we were unable to include a traditional oven with stovetop. If you have any questions about the kitchenette, please just let us know! ) This kitchenette also includes dishes (mugs, larger cups, plates, bowls and silverware)  and a folding tray for reading or enjoying your meals in bed.  During the warmer season, we provide a retro cooler for your use while fishing or picnicking.

You will also have your own private bathroom with an antique sink and claw foot tub (with shower).  We provide you with towels, washcloths, soap, shampoo, conditioner, bubble bath and a hair dryer. (If you've forgotten anything else, just let us know- we probably have extras!)

The Cottage also has, what we call, a "mud room."  It's a small room where you'll find a bench and a picnic basket (during season).  During the holidays, the mudroom is decked out with a Christmas tree. The mudroom is intended as a place for you to unload, store your umbrella and shed your shoes.  In the winter months, this room is also outfitted with boot warmers.  

The main room houses a queen size bed, a rocking chair, a tv (w/ dvd player), and a dresser (which converts into a lighted desk.) We also provide you with an iron and ironing board.  There is not a closet; however, there is a hook on the door for hanging your garment bag. The bedding is composed of two down alternative pillows, two "SpaLuxury" pillows, and two 100% cotton blankets.  There are three separate heaters located throughout the cottage. There is also a window air conditioner. The main room/bedroom overlooks the pond with an entire wall of windows (don't worry- there are room-darkening curtains if you prefer to sleep in!)  

If you would like to bring your child(ren), please send me a message beforehand.  I am sure that a small air mattress will fit beside the queen size bed (and I will prepare it for you!), but I want to share exact dimensions with you to ensure you'll be pleased with the layout of the room. Also, if you're bringing young children, please let me know!  I will ensure the cottage is stocked with some age-appropriate toys. 

Regarding breakfast, your kitchen will be stocked with a standard brew of coffee, as well as tea bags.  Upon your arrival, you will find a basket of fruit and zucchini bread (or something similar), as well as a couple bottles of water in your fridge. We have decided to leave this welcome/breakfast basket for you so as not to disturb your sleep the next morning.  During the winter months, your kitchen is also stocked with hot cocoa mix.

We currently have a dog, cats, and a chicken.  This past winter has been hard on the animals.  Pumpkin, our pet turkey passed away, as well as our duck, and one of the chickens. This spring (2023), we will be getting baby chickens, ducks and turkeys.

**Update April 2023:  We had a very bad windstorm and a handsome little rooster blew in and has fallen deeply in love with our Chicken Little.  They have moved into Pumpkin's old house and are inseparable. We realize he's an early riser and not all of us are--- so we are now providing ear plugs for each guest in the cottage (just in case.)

The entire Cottage is for your use.  

Rental of the cottage includes a souvenir fishing permit.  This will give you complete access to the fishing supplies in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we'll have it unlocked for you.  We do require that after any photographs, you throw your fish back in the pond. (Swimming is not allowed in the pond.) (Ice skating on the pond is also not allowed.)

We are currently building a pencil museum for Jill's collection.  The pencil museum opens up to our Blackberry Boardwalk.  It's a nice walkway through the edge of the woods near the pond.  It also helps make the blackberries more accessible during season (they're typically ripe in August and you're welcome to help yourself!) Although the museum is still in a construction phase, the Blackberry Boardwalk is complete.

Also, we are located in a very popular area for ATV riders.  We are 38.8 miles to the Pocahontas Trail Head (Hatfield & McCoy ATV & UTV Trails).  You are welcome to use any tools in our garage for maintenance of your ATV or UTV while you are visiting. 

You're free to walk throughout the property, including the gardens.  Please also treat the gardens like a buffet.  You're welcome to eat all of the vegetables and fruit you want while you're here.  You're also welcome to help with any animal chores and gardening (especially fun for kids!) and we love to answer any questions you have.

When it is time for your check-out, you can just walk away!  No cleaning or locking up needed.  We like for folks to be able to completely relax and not worry about any of the details. :-)

You will see us on the property.  We have five children living here, ranging in age from seven to eighteen.  Don't worry- they will not bother you at all- but you will probably see them outside playing.  If you need anything, I am a stay-at-home mom and am easily accessible during the day.  I can frequently be found in the kitchen, our library or the greenhouse.  We dearly love to show folks around our place and answer any questions you may have about our home, gardens, animals and/or the area.

sectionedDescription/space:
The Storybook Cottage is a fairytale-inspired tiny crooked house.  The Cottage is located directly behind our house - which is in the process of being converted into a castle. Our property houses apple trees, plum trees, cherry trees, grapevines, peach trees, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, and pear trees- in addition to mass quantities of vegetables. 

In the photographs posted, you'll be able to see more about the property, the placement of the Cottage in relation to the main house, and some of the animals. :-)

In the Cottage, you'll find books, board games, and general whimsy. During the late spring and summer, the front porch opens up into an edible front yard- feel free to help yourself!  The back porch overlooks the pond (beautiful, but not suitable for skating!).  Rental of the cottage comes with access to the fishing supplies located in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we keep it unlocked for our guests.  (However, swimming is not allowed in the pond- and when it's frozen over, no skating is allowed either.)

The Cottage is a tiny house, yet still has a lot of amenities!  You have your own private kitchenette, equipped with a sink, mini-fridge, breakfast station (which includes a coffee pot, toaster oven and griddle), a microwave and a table with seats for two.  (Due to the size of this kitchenette, we were unable to include a traditional oven with stovetop. If you have any questions about the kitchenette, please just let us know! ) This kitchenette also includes dishes (mugs, larger cups, plates, bowls and silverware)  and a folding tray for reading or enjoying your meals in bed.  During the warmer season, we provide a retro cooler for your use while fishing or picnicking.

You will also have your own private bathroom with an antique sink and claw foot tub (with shower).  We provide you with towels, washcloths, soap, shampoo, conditioner, bubble bath and a hair dryer. (If you've forgotten anything else, just let us know- we probably have extras!)

The Cottage also has, what we call, a "mud room."  It's a small room where you'll find a bench and a picnic basket (during season).  During the holidays, the mudroom is decked out with a Christmas tree. The mudroom is intended as a place for you to unload, store your umbrella and shed your shoes.  In the winter months, this room is also outfitted with boot warmers.  

The main room houses a queen size bed, a rocking chair, a tv (w/ dvd player), and a dresser (which converts into a lighted desk.) We also provide you with an iron and ironing board.  There is not a closet; however, there is a hook on the door for hanging your garment bag. The bedding is composed of two down alternative pillows, two "SpaLuxury" pillows, and two 100% cotton blankets.  There are three separate heaters located throughout the cottage. There is also a window air conditioner. The main room/bedroom overlooks the pond with an entire wall of windows (don't worry- there are room-darkening curtains if you prefer to sleep in!)  

If you would like to bring your child(ren), please send me a message beforehand.  I am sure that a small air mattress will fit beside the queen size bed (and I will prepare it for you!), but I want to share exact dimensions with you to ensure you'll be pleased with the layout of the room. Regarding breakfast, your kitchen will be stocked with a standard brew of coffee, as well as tea bags. name: Country Cottage
sectionedDescription/description:
Country Cottage is located in scenic Southwest Virginia, it's a very private property with direct access to the Spearhead Trails Coal Canyon Trail! This cabin is quiet and perfect for nature lovers and riders with quick access to shopping and local restaurants. Sit on the porch and cookout with the outdoor grill and picnic table on property. This property offers privacy and security for your family as well as your vehicles & UTV's. Not only is it perfect for UTV enthusiasts but families as well!

We typically let guests do self check in, sometimes my husband does like to meet the guests if he’s available when they arrive. We are here should any issues occur.

The cabin is close to the town but still secluded, a 24 hour gas station and restaurants are very close by.

The driveway is steep, any guest with a trailer will need a 4 wheel drive. Any large trailer will need to park on the flat right below the driveway. A 4wd is typically preferred but many cars have made it with no trouble. During the winter months of snow/ice should be present, access to the cabin could be difficult but parking and walking up is an option that others have done. We just like to make guests aware before arrival so they use their judgement.

primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. Only one hour to Winterplace Ski Resort.  Also an hour drive to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails!Each room has a private programmable lock. Each room will have towels, shampoo and soap for two. Newly paved driveway with room for cars and bikes

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

cozy 2nd floor room with closet. Queen size bed, 40" smart TV, nightstand and dresser. access to shared kitchen, living and bathrooms. Relax on one of the two porches and enjoy the mountain views. Deer roaming is a regular occurrence as well!

Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.

I am available 24/7 by phone if anything is needed. I am also available for recommendations on request.

Tazewell is known for a lot of things but public transportation may not be one of them. Everything you need is less than 10 minutes drive away including shopping, dining and activities.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

additionalHouseRules:
You must also acknowledge: 

Security deposit: You may be charged up to $450 to cover damages.

No-smoking policy: This property is a 100-percent smoke-free home. Smoking is not allowed inside or outside the property. This policy is strictly enforced. Failure to comply will result in immediately being asked to leave with no refund and forfeiture of the damage deposit.

Pets: Dogs only, please. The pet fee is $20 per week (including any stay up to a week) for the first dog and $10 per week for a second dog. No more than two dogs. Dogs should be crated when left alone. Please clean up the yard after your pets and dispose of poop bags in the outdoor trashcan. Owners are responsible for their pets when outside in public; Glade Spring does have a leash law. Failure to acknowledge pets and to pay the related fees will result in guests immediately being asked to leave with no refund.

Porch sitting is highly recommended but quiet hours do begin at 10 pm.

Additional instructions will be shared to look over when you arrive.

name: LOFT🌿 Peaceful & charming 1.4 mi from I-81 Exit29
photos/3/caption: The bathroom is a generous size, with beautiful styling and accessories. A band of unique wallpaper is the crowning touch.
photos/4/caption: With its oversized sofa & chairs, the living room is the heart of this home. The space is stocked with a 50-inch smart TV, games, and books. Along with the kitchen, the great room provides a comfortable space for guests to gather.
photos/5/caption: Infrared fireplace stoves placed in each bedroom for a nice Winter ambience and to keep guests extra cozy warm during their stay at the loft (Can turn off and on/adjust temperature to suit own preferences.).
photos/6/caption: There is ample storage space in the master bedroom, including this chest of drawers and a closet.
photos/7/caption: The second bedroom is found behind a set of French doors that allow extra lighting into the room. A set of blinds can be lowered for privacy.
photos/9/caption: A view in the second bedroom of the privacy blind partially lowered.
photos/10/caption: A highlight of the bathroom is the brass faucet and other thoughtful design touches.
photos/12/caption: The wide covered porch has plentiful seating, including a cushioned sitting area and a cafe table set for coffee or snacks.
photos/14/caption: The master bedroom is an oasis of natural light and creative design details. The queen bed features a new memory-foam mattress.
photos/15/caption: A privacy wall adds an intimate and contemporary feel to the porch sitting area.
photos/16/caption: Iron handrails on both sides of the stairs provide extra safety.
photos/20/caption: Nighttime lighting sets the mood for an enjoyable evening outdoors.
photos/23/caption: A long fence extends from the front of the structure along the length of the yard. Landcape features complement the loft exterior.
photos/24/caption: A workdesk provides the perfect space for your on-the-road office needs. A wide selection of local brochures are provided to help acquaint you with the area and what it has to offer.
photos/25/caption: A set of cabana blinds add to the vacation vibe while also protecting the porch from rainwater. They're also useful for extra shading as the sun sets each evening.
primaryHost/about: Greetings! I am a business owner in my hometown of Glade Spring. I’m also the mother of three grown sons. When not enjoying the great outdoors, I indulge my passion for designing and building things. Hospitality is my love language, and I desire to make people feel comfortable and furnish spaces in the name of gathering. Fiddlehead Loft is the result of my combined interests. With this place, I am dedicated to providing a relaxing and pampered rental experience for everyone, whether you are a road-weary traveler or a visitor to our beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains region. I’d love to host you!
sectionedDescription/description:
Fiddlehead Loft is a newly renovated, thoughtful space stocked with guests in mind at every turn. Each hammered nail, design detail, and pillow purchase was executed with great hopes to serve you well and provide a beautiful, cozy environment for you to relax and enjoy your stay in. If we don’t have what you need, let us know!

Recent guest commentary: “We thoroughly enjoyed staying in your loft. So peaceful and quiet, with all the comforts of home… It’s a little diamond!” – June 7, 2021

When you first arrive at Fiddlehead Loft, you will see private parking for four cars. Enter the almost entirely enclosed & fenced yard, walk up the graveled path, and ascend the outside staircase to the second-floor loft. You’ll find yourself on a spacious covered porch with plenty of seating, including several chairs and a café table set that’s perfect for morning coffee or a snack (Brand new hammock on the way!)

Upon entering the loft, the first thing you’ll notice is the combination of warm tones and light walls with several windows letting in ample light. The stylish and modern décor throughout features greens and muted yellows, grays and browns, creams and blacks, all accented with natural fibers and live plants. This first room is a great room that encompasses a kitchen and dining area on one side and a living room on the other. A mini-split air conditioner is controlled from the living room but heats and cools the whole space.

In the living room to the right sits a comfy leather sofa and several oversized sectional chairs. A 50-inch smart TV and a bookcase filled with games, books, and magazines are ready for your relaxation. Or, if work is on the schedule, you can make use of the workspace separating the kitchen/dining area and living room. The loft is equipped with Wi-Fi. 

To the left is a beautiful modern kitchen and dining area. The table seats four (with room for two more at the workstation). The kitchen is filled with everything you’ll need to cook and serve, including a full-sized range and fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Plentiful cabinet and drawer space holds plate- and glassware, serving pieces, cutlery, utensils, and other small appliances, along with pots and pans. There’s also room for you to tuck away any food you purchase for your stay.

Moving through the great room toward the back of the loft space, you find on your right a lovely bathroom featuring a glass-enclosed full bath/shower combo. Brushed gold and black accents complement the white walls and gorgeous wallpaper, and a repurposed table creates the perfect vanity and sink space. The bathroom is stocked with plenty of towels and toilet paper for your stay.

Directly across from the bathroom sits an enclosed space with a stacked washer and dryer for your laundry needs.

Last, you’ll find two bedrooms in the back of the loft. The bright, naturally lit master bedroom sits to the right. A queen bed with a new memory-foam mattress is covered in soft, rich bedding, while two bedside tables sit ready to hold your current book, glasses, or nighttime toiletries. Double sconces mean you won’t have to fight with your bedmate over late-night reading. A bench at the foot of the bed is the perfect space for putting on your shoes or setting bags, while a full-sized dresser and closet await your clothes and accessories.

The cozy second bedroom sits in the back left corner of the loft. Glass French doors allow plenty of light into the space even when the doors are closed, but a pull-down shade provides privacy and darkness at night. This room contains a sturdy bunkbed set holding two double-sized mattresses with comfy bedding. There’s plenty of space to store your belongings and sconce lighting for both beds.

Filled with beautiful accents and thoughtful touches throughout, Fiddlehead Loft is the perfect home away from home for your long- or short-term travel needs. 

Notes:
•	A well-behaved and housetrained dog is welcome with a $20 nonrefundable fee per week ($10 per week for a second dog) to be collected in a separate payment. Please let us know when you book that you will be bringing a dog, so we can arrange payment. Dogs must be crated when left alone in the loft.
•	Fiddlehead Loft, although having the impression of being it's own structure, is located on the back of a building over a set of office suites (which are entered through the front of the building on a completely different side). They are almost always empty during the day and it remains very quiet. At night, the lower lever is most assuredly vacant, so you are alone in the building. 
•	Like many towns and cities in Virginia, Glade Spring is an historic railroad town, and a set of tracks does go through nearby. But the sounds are buffered and muted indoors, and guests report no issues. However, if you are particularly sensitive to outside sounds, you may wish to look elsewhere. 
•	Fiddlehead Loft is reached by a set of outdoor stairs to the second story. Those with mobility concerns may want to consider another property.

I am respectful of your privacy and will not be onsite during your stay, but I am happy to help in any way and live only a short distance if needed. Renters have full access to me via text or phone.

**Please note the loft is accessed from a side street to the back of the property.**

Glade Spring, Virginia
Located in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Southwest Virginia, Glade Spring is a quaint and peaceful little town boasting an historic square listed on the National Register of Historic Places. With easy access to the interstate and several restaurants and gas stations, it’s a convenient stop for travelers, especially those coming to the area for its many outdoor activities.

Fiddlehead Loft is located:

• 1.4 miles from I-81 on a quiet side street off Glade Spring’s historic town square. 
• 2 miles from the rails-to-trails gem The Salt Trail, the perfect place for a peaceful walk, bike, or horse ride in nature.
• 5 minutes from charming Emory, the home of beautiful Emory & Henry College. (Fiddlehead Loft is conveniently located for game-day lodging!)
• 10 mins from historic Abingdon with numerous excellent restaurants and shops, an award-winning winery, several coffeehouses, a hip brewery, and the world-renowned Barter Theatre.
• 15 mins from playful Damascus, known as Trail Town, USA. Experience the famous Creeper Trail bike ride off White Top Mountain or hop on a beautiful Virginia section of the Appalachian Trail.
• 30 minutes from the famous State Street of Bristol, VA-TN, with a variety of restaurants, shops, breweries, the 24-hour Blackbird Bakery, and the Birthplace of Country Music Museum. Don’t forget the requisite selfie of yourself standing with one foot in Virginia and one in Tennessee!
• Central to many outdoor adventure opportunities in our Blue Ridge Mountains, such as hiking in Mount Rogers National Recreation Area (look for the famous wild ponies), biking the Creeper Trail, or boating on gorgeous South Holston Lake.

** If you are looking for a last minute place to stay for the night, please feel free to send a request. I will do all I can to try to work it out.


** If you see there is only one available night left on a given weekend and you wish to stay only that one night, please contact me.

• 2 miles from the rails-to-trails gem The Salt Trail, the perfect place for a peaceful walk, bike, or horse ride in nature.
• 5 minutes from charming Emory, the home of beautiful Emory & Henry College. (Fiddlehead Loft is conveniently located for game-day lodging!)
• 10 mins from historic Abingdon with numerous excellent restaurants and shops, an award-winning winery, several coffeehouses, a hip brewery, and the world-renowned Barter Theatre.
• 15 mins from playful Damascus, known as Trail Town, USA. Experience the famous Creeper Trail bike ride off White Top Mountain or hop on a beautiful Virginia section of the Appalachian Trail.
• 30 minutes from the famous State Street of Bristol, VA-TN, with a variety of restaurants, shops, breweries, the 24-hour Blackbird Bakery, and the Birthplace of Country Music Museum. Don’t forget the requisite selfie of yourself standing with one foot in Virginia and one in Tennessee!
• Central to many outdoor adventure opportunities in our Blue Ridge Mountains, such as hiking in Mount Rogers National Recreation Area (look for the famous wild ponies & long horn cattle), biking the Creeper Trail, or boating on gorgeous South Holston Lake.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
You must also acknowledge: 

Security deposit: You may be charged up to $450 to cover damages.

No-smoking policy: This property is a 100-percent smoke-free home. Smoking is not allowed inside or outside the property. This policy is strictly enforced. Failure to comply will result in immediately being asked to leave with no refund and forfeiture of the damage deposit.

Pets: Dogs only, please. The pet fee is $20 per week (including any stay up to a week) for the first dog and $10 per week for a second dog. No more than two dogs. Dogs should be crated when left alone. Please clean up the yard after your pets and dispose of poop bags in the outdoor trashcan. Owners are responsible for their pets when outside in public; Glade Spring does have a leash law. Failure to acknowledge pets and to pay the related fees will result in guests immediately being asked to leave with no refund.

Porch sitting is highly recommended but quiet hours do begin at 10 pm.

Additional instructions will be shared to look over when you arrive.

sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.

GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!
