primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the best sleeping room in the house. Hot water radiator heat keeps the room warm in the winter and concrete floors keep it comfortably cool in the summer. There's access to a full bath with tub and shower but you must walk up a flight of stairs. I also try to keep the house as free from allergens/fragrances as possible for guests who have sensitivities (noted in House Rules below).

The wi-fi is very poor in the bedroom but great in the parlor room just down the hall.

Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)

I'm in and out of the spaces with shared access but your bed and bath are always private. I like to socialize and interact with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

There's a great little biking road about 1/4 mile from my home that lots of bikers love to ride. About 5 miles away is a great mountain bike trail at the Blfd WV city park. For more serious bikers, there's the Burkes Garden trail. 
For hikers, Lincolnshire Park, about 13 miles away in Tazewell, has features so beautiful you will think you're in the The Hobbit's  "Shire." 
For other things to do and places to eat, see my Guidebook section of Guest Resources.

The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price.

CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

sectionedDescription/transit: The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

sectionedDescription/description:
We invite you to kick back and enjoy a taste of the country life while visiting beautiful Appalacia.  One hundred year old farm house that is newly renovated on 16 acres of Appalachian hardwood forest and pasture land and situated just 2.5 miles from the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System and 30 minutes to Winterplace.  Located centrally between the cities Bluefield and Princeton, while being conveniently located two miles from Bluewell and just six miles from historic Bramwell, WV.

Beautiful 16 acres for wooded landscape cover with chicory plants which Bluefield was named after.

name: The Cottage Around the Corner
photos/0/caption: Welcome to The Cottage Around The Corner
photos/5/caption: The open kitchen/living room area has a 13' ceiling with an exposed beam and a beautiful chandelier, providing guests a large space to gather for dinner, watch a movie, or play a game.
photos/6/caption: The island in the kitchen is 6' long with a butcher block counter for prepping meals and extra seating for guests.
photos/9/caption: A 43  inch smart TV  provides entertainment by connecting to Netflix and other media streaming devices.
photos/10/caption: The kitchen has lots of storage and prep space. The stainless steel appliances are all new.
photos/12/caption: There is a good collection of pots and pans for cooking, an array of utensils, and dinnerware to serve all guests.
photos/13/caption: The kitchen has a coffee station with a Keurig machine and a variety of Kcups to fix your morning coffee and get your day off to a great start.
photos/15/caption: A variety of cups and glasses, an ice bucket, and beverage containers are on hand for guests.
photos/16/caption: Back door leading to the fenced area for outdoor grilling and fire pit.
photos/18/caption: Books, magazines, playing cards, and board games have been placed in the cottage for entertainment.
photos/20/caption: The home is equipped with a heat pump to provide a constant comfortable temperature year-round. The Ecobee Smart Thermostat uses touch screen technology that makes navigating the temperature easy.
photos/21/caption: Painted a warm yellow, this bedroom is sunny and bright during the day, but a restful night awaits guests with a queen-sized bed and a new memory foam mattress.
photos/22/caption: A desk equipped with office supplies and free wifi access provides travelers a comfortable space to work quietly.
photos/24/caption: This bedroom provides guests with a large walk-in closet for storage. Both twin beds have new memory foam mattresses.
photos/26/caption: The classic gray and white bathroom provides plenty of space to get ready in the morning. With a  tilting mirror and beautiful chrome industrial vanity lighting,  you are sure to look your best.
photos/27/caption: The ceramic tile floors are stunning and the bathtub/shower is surrounded by white subway tile and finished off with a rain shower fixture for plenty of water!
photos/30/caption: New for Summer 2023…Beautiful fenced yard with solar outdoor lights.
photos/31/caption: Stone and pea gravel complete the outdoor area with rocking chairs adorning the covered porch.
photos/32/caption: Fire pit with four Adirondack chairs. Wooden picnic table with 2 benches.
photos/34/caption: Welcome to the Cottage Around the Corner
primaryHost/about: My husband Joe and I were born and raised here in beautiful Washington County Virginia. We are Emory and Henry College Alumni and chose to continue to live and raise our children in the place we love. We know how special this region is and that is why we are excited to welcome you to our Cottage Around the Corner!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Right around the corner or right on the way, the Cottage Around the Corner is convenient for travelers. Whether visiting the beautiful mountains to bike or hike the Creeper Trail, sightseeing in the historical Abingdon or Bristol area, attending a game at E&H or just passing through to another destination, our goal is to provide a warm and welcoming home for your getaway. Resting on an acre of land and right off I 81 enjoy your stay in our cozy, country cottage.

The cottage sits on the corner of our family farm. It faces the road and is backed by open farmland. There is a private driveway for parking your car. A stone path leads from the driveway up 4 steps onto a covered porch. The front door has a keyless entry for your convenience. 

* The cottage entry is also accessible from a covered porch on the opposite side of the home with only one step off the grass. The entry door is not keyless. Please let us know if we can accommodate you with access.

When you enter the cottage, you will see that the living, kitchen, and dining area are open concept with a 13 ft. ceiling. We hope you will find this space warm and inviting with an exposed wood beam and large chandelier. The furniture is all new and carefully selected for the charm and most importantly comfort. There is a 43” Smart TV with Netflix in the living area and free Wi-Fi. The full kitchen area is truly open to the rest of the space and is equipped with everything you'd need to make delicious meals.

Entering the hallway from the living area, you will find the bathroom on the left. It features classic gray and white décor. The tub/shower is surrounded by subway wall tiles and a rain shower water fixture provides a great morning shower. The bathroom cabinets house enough towels, washcloths, bathmats, hairdryer, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion for your stay at the cottage.

At the end of the hallway, double doors enclose the full-size washer and dryer. The laundry area also has an ironing board and iron, detergent, and dryer sheets.

The cottage has 2 separate bedrooms. Bedroom one is bright and sunny with a queen-size bed and a new memory foam mattress.  Bedroom two, painted a restful mountain blue has 2 twin-size beds and new memory foam mattresses. Both bedrooms are equipped with sheets, blankets, extra pillows, and luggage stands. There are closets in both bedrooms with plenty of storage and hangers for your clothing. There is also a portable crib available. 

With land surrounding the cottage and big trees providing shade, kids will enjoy playing outside, so bring your favorite outside games. There is a large covered porch with 2 rocking chairs. In the future, we plan to screen in the porch and add an outside entertainment area. 

Right off an interstate 81 exit, and 0.3 miles down the road our cottage is a very convenient location for just a one-night stay or an entire week or more. Please keep in mind that you will hear traffic noise from the interstate while outside. Extra construction measures were taken to provide a house that is quiet inside both day and night.

If you have special requests for your stay, just ask and we will try to accommodate.

Don’t miss it while you are here. Or come back if you do!

•	5 minutes to Emory & Henry College
•	5 minutes to The Salt Trail (bike riding or walking)
•	11 mins to Historic Abingdon (quaint shops, unique restaurants, and coffee shops), Barter Theatre, Abingdon Vineyards, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Festival
•	15 mins to Damascus (Creeper Trail bike ride from White Top Mountain Station to Damascus)
•	22 mins to Hungry Mother Park/Lake, Marion VA 
•	30 mins to Bristol, VA-TN (variety of restaurants and shops, the Birthplace of Country Music Museum, Bristol Motor Speedway, Bristol Rhythm and Roots

name: The Dragon's Den - Upstairs Private Room 3
photos/14/caption: Rent me on Riders Share. No motorcycle license required!
primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access:
Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. One hour to Winterplace Ski Resort, WV. Also one hour to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails.. High speed wireless internet throughout the entire property. 40" HD Smart TV in every room.

This is a second floor bedroom with access to the kitchen, bathroom and patio. Room has a 40" HD smart TV and WiFi enabling you to use your favorite streaming app. Enjoy the entire home including kitchen, 2 bathrooms and front and back porches.

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.

Either myself or someone that works with me will be available 24/7 during your stay making sure it is comfortable and relaxing.

Come explore historic downtown Tazewell, VA and everything it has to offer. Walking distance to breweries and restaurants, Tazewell is a beautiful place to relax and call home for the weekend.

Not much public transportation so a car/motorcycle is required.

The house is on a septic system.  Only the provided toilet paper can be flushed.  All other items need to be disposed of in provided bins.  There will be an additional fee of $25 for use of the airbed or pull out couch.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

name: Luxury Suite Downtown Abingdon VA
primaryHost/about: Adventuring through life. We use Airbnb for most of our trips, traveling with our kids or on getaways. Always choosing happiness and now enjoying hosting our own place to pass on the beauty of this community.
sectionedDescription/access:
Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is a large private suite in the heart of downtown Abingdon Virginia. 

Located within 2 blocks of the Creeper Trail and right on Courthouse hill. There is no better location for your visit to Abingdon! 

Enjoy this Luxury Suite with unique amenities such as walk in shower, king size bed, original brick walls, and stained glass windows.

Wake up overlooking Main St. in this historic and beautiful town, while enjoying all the luxuries of modern amenities.

Built in 1894 and taking a total of 10 years to complete, The Greenway Trigg building is a wealth of charm and history.
Come spend time immersing yourself in the quaint history of Abingdon, VA.

What better way to do that than to stay in a 100+ year old building?! 
The Greenway Trigg building underwent a massive update in 2022 and is ready for bookings, new life, and new and modern retail spaces. 

This listing has had a complete make over! Previous reviews will specify things that are not applicable to the new space! Please be aware of that!

Enjoy the new retail spaces on the main level of the building, and the many pieces of art available for sale in the foyers of the grand old building.

Don't forget to peruse SONDER home + travel where you can find amenities used in your Suite available to purchase and take home with you.

Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.

We are always available via message on the Airbnb app. Please do not call unless it is an emergency.

There is no better location to immerse yourself in the experience of Abingdon than right here in The Greenway Trigg building. 
Located within walking distance of The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, White Birch Juice, The girl and the raven coffee shop, Wolf Hills Brewery and many many more attractions!

Bikes can be rented from the bike shop right around the corner. Walking is easy in all areas of downtown.

If you are bringing a dog- we ask that all pets are kept off the furniture. THIS IS A MUST. We are happy to have your pet stay, and are able to by requiring an additional pet fee. If we find that there is a pet and we were not notified previously, a $250 fee will be added to the booking total.

name: Whispering Pines Private Cabin 5 mins off I-77
primaryHost/about: We are a nature loving and hard working family. We came to Bland several years ago for the beauty and private way of living. Walkers Valley is one of the most beautiful places you will ever see. Serenity, peacefulness, and the beauty of the mountains, are all the reasons we moved here.  We invite you, our guests, to come and see for yourself. We promise, if you love the outdoors as much as we do, you will be able to appreciate the beauty of Bland, Va.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enchanted cozy cabin " Whispering Pines " located 5 minutes off I-77 in Bland, Va.  Our cabin is  located on 8 acres of property and full  of various types of wildlife.  Sometimes, you will see bear, deer, wild turkey, and squirrels. We also live on the property, but the cabin is private and  tucked away within the beautiful whispering pines.

. The interior has recently been updated with appliances and decor including farmhouse style. The exterior of the cabin has also been recently renovated. There is a  peaceful fire pit for your family to enjoy.  You will need an All Wheel Drive (AWD) or Four -Wheel Drive vehicle (4x4) in order to drive all the way to the cabin because the incline is a little steep for a 2 wheel drive. There  is a parking lot at the top of this incline for all the Non-AWD and Non-4x4 vehicles.  Please note, you will only have to walk approximately 75 yards down the hill to the cabin. The other Parking lot is at the bottom. Upon request, a pack & play can be provided for your baby or toddler. The cabin is NOT wheelchair accessible and has NO WIFI! Cell service is limited to Verizon, however AT&T will pick up 1 bar and LTE. The cabin has No cable TV; however, there is a 42 inch TV available with multi-selection DVDs for adults and children.  We have also included a selection of books for adults and children. Our property has 2 ponds,  a mid-sized refrigerator, sink, dishes, pots/pans,  silverware, cooking utensils, and a Keurig coffee pot. Enjoy your evening sitting by the firepit or gazebo by the pond. Although, our water source is from freshwater springs, we do advise not to drink, to be on the safe side; however you can boil the water for drinking and cooking. We will provide each guest with one bottle of drinking water.  Whispering Pines cabin is sparkling clean and  very quiet with a peaceful rustic setting.

Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.

Available by cell phone.

This cabin is nestled in the Blue Ridge mountains surrounded by the Washington Jefferson National Forest. There are many Appalachian trail heads  in Bland county and  many things to do nearby. The closest Appalachian trailhead from the cabin is only 2.1 miles. Fort Chiswell Animal Park(16 miles), Wytheville (11 miles), Dismal Falls Retreat (14 miles), Wolf Creek Indian village and Museum (5.3 miles), Big Walker Lookout (10.6 miles), Dollar General (2.1 miles), Grants supermarket (1.8 miles), and some of the best sandwiches, cheeses, furniture, and Amish hospitality around,  Walkers Valley Market(16 miles).

24 hours before your arrival I will provide you a Key Code for the Lock Box.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
No swimming or ice skating in ponds !!! Children must be supervised at all times !! Do not feed wildlife !
Do not leave trash outside.  No smoking inside. Fire pit must be out complete before you leave or go to bed. Shoes off when entering the home. Lock door if going out or leaving premises. By signing house rules agreement we are not liable for any accident or injury on our property.

sectionedDescription/summary: Enchanted cozy cabin " Whispering Pines " located 5 minutes off I-77 in Bland, Va.  Our cabin is  located on 8 acres of property and full  of various types of wildlife.  Sometimes, you will see bear, deer, wild turkey, and squirrels. We also live on the property, but the cabin is private and  tucked away within the beautiful whispering pines.

sectionedDescription/access: Entire home and property including creek- enjoy but wear shoes if wading in creek to be safe.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Olde Springhouse is our cozy cottage just one block off of Main street and a few more from the Virginia Creeper Trail-Head.  This gem is at the epicenter of shops, restaurants and nightlife!  Park upon arrival and enjoy all our quaint town offers within walking distance- The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, Jack's 128 Pecan, Foresta, Summers Rooftop/Cellar, Rain, The Girl and The Raven, Wolf Hills Brewery, and much, much more- and it was literally built over a spring!

We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away.  There is a mudroom with a bike rack for 5 bikes, and even a full sized mtn bike on-site for your convenience. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercise outdoors and steps away from the cottage.  Across the street from The Old Springhouse is a public park with lots of fun things for the kids and adults alike- including a covered picnic area and barbeque grill. The cottage also sits on Towne Creek with its famous resident Mallards!  Be careful though, as the creek runs thru town and is prone to have glass or debris in it. Wear shoes if wading!  There is a private driveway at the cottage but if you have more than one car, feel free to park across the street at the park.  Legend has it the park was home to the main town spring from which everyone got their drinking water.

Entire home and property including creek- enjoy but wear shoes if wading in creek to be safe.

You will have coded access to the house but we live just two blocks away so let us know if you need anything!

Literally you are within steps of the finest restaurants and theater that our area has to offer.  The renowned Highlands Festival takes place just at the top of the hill as well as Plum Alley Days and as mentioned, The Creeper trail-head and bike shops are a few blocks away. We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercize outdoors and steps away from the cottage. Hope to see you soon. Enjoy and stay safe!

Unless you are heading to the River, the Lake, or the AT, you can literally park your car and not move it until checkout- the best location around!

There is a firehouse across the street but the responders are VERY sympathetic to local residents and don't turn on their sirens until they are past the house and get on main street.  Also, Abingdon has a train track running the length of town- any house in town is “close”.  Several trains run during the course of the day, FYI.

photos/23/caption: Inside the Channels
primaryHost/about: My families connection with this mountain goes back 40 years and we are so excited to share its breathtaking beauty with you!
sectionedDescription/access: Free parking at the cabin, The cabin is easily accessible by most cars and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.
sectionedDescription/description:
Step back in time with this original 1890s Appalachian solar powered off grid cabin. 

The cabin has been renovated with all the modern conveniences: solar-powered and includes hot water, gas stove, full bathroom w/ shower, refrigerator, sleeper sofa folds out to queen size bed. With each stay fresh towels and linens are furnished.

Kitchen, hot/cold kitchen sink,  K cup friendly coffee machine and more!
Covered front porch with bench and 2 rockers. Off the porch is a picnic table and gas grill.

Before you make your reservation
MAKE SURE YOUR GUEST COUNT IS CORRECT.

Loft Queen size bed sleeps 2
Living room has sofa sleeper

The loft area has low clearance sloped ceilings but can still comfortably sleep adults.

Water is provided via well with filtration system that includes UV light for excellent purification. 
Well appointed kitchen is fully stocked with all the necessities you need to cook your meals such as pots, pans and silverware. It features a gas stove with oven. 

While the cabin's address is listed as being in Saltville VA, the property is actually located in Washington County and is closer to the Abingdon VA area on Hayters Gap Road ,Rt 80.

Standard check-in time is 3 PM.
Standard check out time 11 am.

More info on channelsretreat .com

Free parking at the cabin, The cabin is easily accessible by most cars and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.

We look forward to having you and are available should you have any questions during your stay. Feel free to contact me at any time with any questions or concerns that you may have.
Please reach out to me at least an hour before your arrival so that I can give you your keycode and answer any questions you may have regarding your stay.

Sit under the stars by night and under the magnificent canopy of shade trees by day.                          

Clinch Mountain is home to beautiful plant life and undergrowth, while a variety of deciduous trees form a towering canopy above.

It is truly a birdwatcher and botanist paradise.

Location is right on the trail leading to the Channel’s and is the last privately owned parcel upon entering channels state forest and natural preserve.

The great Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountains summit and form one of Virginia’s most fascinating ecosystems. It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels , which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate .Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob’s summit ,this hike forms one of southwest Virginia’s most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

The hike is a hidden gem in southwest Virginia and you will find nothing else in Virginia quite like it . For the more adventurous hiker, the hike can continue on to Hidden Valley Lake ( 14 mile hike).

The road that leads to the cabin is off of the route 80 trailhead at the Russell / Washington county line. The gravel road leading to the cabin is shared with the hiking trail leading to the channels.

Step right outside of the front door at The Channels Retreat and you will be greeted by the trail's most heavily used 3 miles that travel to the Great Channels of Virginia. 

The Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating ecosystems. 

It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate and often hold snow cover long after temperatures have risen above freezing. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

Sorry, we don't allow pets at this cabin.

2 creeks 
Fire pit 
Walking trails
sectionedDescription/description:
Sleeps up to 15 with additional space for air mattresses on 5 acres with two freshwater streams!  As of June 2020, we now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET. 
The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions.  Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

This 5 Bedroom with 2 full and 2 half bathroom home is located on 5 acres in beautiful southwestern Virginia.  
Easily found and accessible from Interstate 77 (13 miles) and Interstate 81 (40 miles).
First floor (main living floor) includes the kitchen, dining, den, laundry, ½ bath and master bed/bathrooms.
Second floor includes the living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 ½ bathrooms.
Third floor includes a finished room with 2 sets of bunk beds.
Other amenities include basic cable television, WIFI internet, washer/dryer and dish washer.
Outside you will find a large wrap around porch and large rear deck with great mountainous views.  A spacious yard with fire pit is bordered on two sides by separate freshwater streams that hold trout at certain times of the year.
We now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET

2 creeks 
Fire pit 
Walking trails

Available for all your questions phone, text or email.

The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions. Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

A wide driveway with egress from a paved county road (Rt. 61) provides entrance to the property and will accommodate multiple large pickup trucks pulling trailers (ATV’s, Horses, etc.) and will also allow excessive room for turn around.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please do not wear shoes in the house, No pets allowed due to allergies. 

No shooting guns on property

Third floor includes a finished room with 2 sets of bunk beds.
Other amenities include basic cable television, WIFI internet, washer/dryer and dish washer.
Outside you will find a large wrap around porch and large rear deck with great mountainous views.  A spacious yard with fire pit is bordered on two sides by separate freshwater streams that hold trout at certain times of the year.
We now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET
sectionedDescription/summary:
Sleeps up to 15 with additional space for air mattresses on 5 acres with two freshwater streams!  As of June 2020, we now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET. 
The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions.  Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.
sectionedDescription/transit: A wide driveway with egress from a paved county road (Rt. 61) provides entrance to the property and will accommodate multiple large pickup trucks pulling trailers (ATV’s, Horses, etc.) and will also allow excessive room for turn around.

Keyless entry to your apartment. 
Free Street parking and also a free parking garage only a block away.
There are stairs to climb to reach your apartment.
sectionedDescription/description:
Surround yourself with understated elegance

Enjoy a great nights sleep on a premium mattress with whisper quiet remote ac. If you feel the need or just want to cook, all appliances are top of the line. And don’t run out to do laundry. Do it as you relax and watch one of the two smart tv’s.
THIS UNIT DOES NOT HAVE A WINDOW WITH A VIEW. THE WINDOW IS FOR EGRESS ONLY. IT DOES NOT GO TO THE OUTSIDE!

We will be available any time that we are needed and would love to meet each guest personally

We are located right in the middle of everything downtown! 
UPike, med school, optometry school, Appalachian Wireless Arena, historical museum, shopping, and restaurants. Pikeville Medical Center is within walking distance.

Walking will be suitable unless you want to venture out.

$20 for up to 6 nights
$50 for 6+ nights

primaryHost/about:
My husband, Jacob, and I like to walk the Appalachian Trail (and other trails) and mountain peaks around Dongola Cabin.  When we aren't out walking or enjoying the outdoors, we enjoy the cabin as a peaceful writing and reading space.  We are keen to share this space with w

sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have access to the entire cabin (excepting a crawl space) and land around the cabin. It also has landline for domestic calls and emergencies.
sectionedDescription/description:
Up on the Laurel’s Dongola Cabin is a secluded, compact 384 square foot cabin designed to be a place for recreating, writing, relaxing and star-gazing. It sits on the south side of Iron Mountain in the Jefferson National Forest’s Mount Rogers National Recreation Area and takes in the scenic views of Whitetop Mountain and Mount Rogers. Its proximity to sites and towns of middle Appalachia, along with its fresh water, fresh air and relaxed pace make our cabin a lovely spot to visit.

Dongola Cabin is ten miles south of Interstate-81 and the town of Chilhowie, Virginia. Atlanta, Charlotte, Roanoke, Richmond, Knoxville, and Washington DC are each between two and six hours drive. Our accommodation includes high speed internet, full kitchen and laundry facilities.  Please note, the nightly rate includes a 5% occupancy tax for Smyth County.  

**We aim to make the cabin as safe as possible for your visiting pleasure.  We disinfect the cabin after each guest and we do not allow back-to-back bookings in order to decrease the possibility of community transmission.**

Guests will have access to the entire cabin (excepting a crawl space) and land around the cabin. It also has landline for domestic calls and emergencies.

We are available by telephone/email/text message for any guests queries or emergencies.

Nearby, several trail heads intersect, including the well-known Appalachian and Virginia Creeper Trails (others include the Iron Mountain Trail, the Skulls Gap Trail, the Buzzard Rock Trail, the Bear Tree Gap Trail, the Straight Mountain Trail, the Straight Branch Trail, and the Pine Mountain Trail). Hundreds of wild blueberry bushes yield end-of-summer fruit on Whitetop and Pine Mountains. Steep mountain valleys and hollows display the colors of Spring and Autumn foliage. The Whitetop Laurel Creek, a notable wild trout stream, stretches for twelve miles down the valley floor and provides year-round fishing as well as five miles of fully accessible recreation facilities with wildlife viewing platforms in the Creek Junction area.

Scenic and historic routes surround Dongola Cabin, including the famous Route 58 ('The Crooked Road'), Grayson Highlands State Park and Parkway, the balds at Elk Garden, and the highest elevated road in Virginia towards the peak of Whitetop Mountain. From Dongola Cabin, outdoor enthusiasts can rent bicycles and lazily (or not) ride 15 miles down the Virginia Creeper Trail to the town of Damascus, take a daylong horseback ride into Pine Mountain and Mount Rogers, or just take in the vista from Dongola Cabin's spacious front porch and vintage gliding swing.

The nearest grocery store is about 30 minutes away in Chilhowie. The cabin will have basic pantry items and a few provisions for emergencies, but guests should be sure to shop for groceries before their arrival. Also, check out: the Konnarock Store and the Whitetop Store which are nearby; the Barter Theatre, and Bella's Pizza in Abingdon; the Damascus Brewery in Damascus.

sectionedDescription/access: The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.
sectionedDescription/description:
Full bath, Queen bed, flat screen TV (dish), free wi-fi. Private entrance. Very safe area. We are located between Abingdon Va. and St. Paul Va. on highway 58.

This rental is in a separate part of our home and offers total privacy. The bed is a queen size so space will only accommodate two adults comfortably. There is one full bath and a small kitchen. The home sits on an acre of property and joins several vacant acres in behind.

The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.

We are always available to our guests to answer questions about the area or to resolve any issues that might occur with the space. You will be provided with our cell and house phone numbers in the event that you need anything, otherwise you will have total privacy.

Quite neighborhood with two miles of walking trails, through the woods, on our property.
In St. Paul, Va. just about 7 miles away is the Sugar Hills ATV and hiking trails, and the newly remodeled "Western Front" with a nice Restaurant. Sugar Hill Brewery is also a great place to eat and experience local beer. 
The Hidden Valley Lake Area offers hiking, boating and fishing, and is just a few miles away. Fifteen- twenty miles away is The Channels, a majestic sandstone formation that is over 400-million years old. Great Hike !  The "Devils Bath Tub" is not to far away and a must see. The Pinnacle Natural Area Reserve is also very close and quite spectacular. The town of Abingdon (18 miles away) is a great little town with some excellent restaurants,  Wolf Hills Brewing Company, The Creeper Trail, The Barter Theater (state theater of Virginia!), biking and walking trails, festivals, and much more.

Please check location of the property before booking. 
Thanks

For guests that will be using the space for extended time periods, we laundry the bed linens, towels and wash cloths once per week.  We do not clean the space or wash the linens with synthetic perfumed products.   We ask that you do not use room deodorizers, incense or scented candles in the space.  We also ask that you use colognes and perfumes sparingly.  We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.

primaryHost/about: Hi, I am Cathy . My family and I live on a beautiful knoll looking out over a pastoral setting.  I am a flight attendant so I have traveled the world for years. I really love Italy and New Zealand.  I have stayed in countless hotels and have tried to take the best of them for our little retreat.  I love ice cream and watermelon, mystery book and British TV mysteries( I can give you lots of ideas).  Hope you will feel like both friends and family when you visit.

Small but all brand new lower level apartment 41/2miles from town, restaurants, the Virginia Creeper trail for biking and walking, South Holston Lake and the Barter Theater (live theater). Its quiet, rural but easy to find.  We are open in the Spring, Summer and Fall.  Come join us!

name: Holston River House - a Sojourn in Serenity...
photos/0/caption: South Fork of the Holston River is your playground for trout fishing or just enjoying the majesty of nature.
photos/1/caption: Our home is designed and appointed for comfort and enjoyment.  Hot tub, open deck, covered porch, perched above the river yet close to town ensure your pleasure.
photos/2/caption: The mighty Holston River is a renowned hatchery supported trout fishing mecca.  We enjoy just sitting above and reflecting on our day.
photos/3/caption: The patio furniture on the deck is to die for...
photos/4/caption: The River House is so close to Abingdon, the Barter Theater, Virginia Creeper Trail, national forest, Marion, Bristol Motor Speedway, Mt. Rogers and more!
photos/5/caption: Peace and quiet abounds on the Holston River in Adwolfe section of Marion, VA.
photos/6/caption: In season you will love the flowers from knock-out roses and azaleas to burning bushes, rhododendron, mountain laurel and more.
photos/7/caption: A mountain river getaway perched on a high bank that slopes to an easy river entry.  You can fish, sit on the bank in our Adirondack chairs, soak in the hot tub and let time roll by...
photos/8/caption: The abundant grounds of the river house are lovely for croquet, peace and quiet and privacy.
photos/9/caption: The River House combines the tranquility peace of nature with extraordinary proximity to Marion, Abingdon and all the amenities of Southwest Virginia.
photos/10/caption: Floating in the warm, wet wonder of the hot tub overlooking this world-class trout stream is an experience that will transport you from the stress of your workaday world to the sublime serenity of nature and contenment.
photos/11/caption: At night the colors and bubbles of the hot tub jets add texture to your experience as you sit above the river's rapids and underneath the mesmerizing, brilliant firmament of dazzling stars and moonlight.
photos/12/caption: Imagine a million ways of engaging this wonder of the world - the South Fork of the Holston River.  Fed by the cold pure mountain spring waters of Mt. Rogers, it is the quintessential habitat for trout.  But it's exquisite merely to meander along.
photos/13/caption: Sometimes our relation with family and friend merely needs time and space to rejuvenate and thrive.  Come, eat, talk and re-connect!
photos/14/caption: Our exquisitely set hot tub is easy to reach with robes and towel in the armoire at the patio door.  But you may linger on the patio furniture and absorb the grandeur of the river.
photos/15/caption: Our home makes it easy to enjoy this magnificent river.  With almost thirty places to sit along and around the river, we've simply ensconced it with comfort.
photos/16/caption: Everything is easy at The River House.  Everything you need for a quiet getaway is right at your fingertips.
photos/17/caption: You'll find the flow and floor plan are easy to navigate and connect you to the covered porch and open deck while giving everyone as much privacy as they desire.
photos/18/caption: You will love the tufted leather furniture in the family room and how natural golden sunshine floods in the floor to ceiling windows.
photos/19/caption: Exquisite Persian Carpets dignify every room with a supple elegance.
photos/20/caption: Play board games at our many tables in almost any indoor or outdoor space you desire.
photos/21/caption: Our lovely day bed with trundle adds two sleeping berths besides our two bedrooms.  And then there are the luxurious sofas...
photos/22/caption: The hall bath is light and airy with attractive ceramic tile.
photos/23/caption: The master bedroom is an excursion into the realm of decadent luxury with a king bed, oriental rug, love seat all on pretty hardwood floors.
photos/24/caption: Our king-sized bed fitted with Macy's "Hotel Collection" finest thread-count cotton linens will leave you in the lap of luxury.
photos/25/caption: The queen bedroom is beautifully appointed with a stout brass rail and piquant artistic lamps.
photos/26/caption: The great room is our pride and joy with a panoply of fine pieces by Hooker, Ferguson-Copeland, Bob Timberlake and more.  The bohkara carpet elevates the entire room.
photos/27/caption: Our great room is your launching point to the open deck and hot tub.  Return to a blazing fireplace in cold weather or let the breeze blow through all summer.
photos/28/caption: Choose between nature or interior.  When you tire of exertion in natural majesty of the river, return inside or outside the River House to rejuvenate.
photos/29/caption: All the baths are clean, light, airy and convenient.
photos/30/caption: Did we say 8' billiard table in the lower level?  Ensconced with a widescreen TV and additional seating it's yet another place to repair privately for nice time with those we love.
photos/31/caption: River breezes are our favorite!  Simply sitting outside around sunrise or sunset are events of breathtaking beauty.
photos/32/caption: Some of the best conversations ensue at this table over grilled steaks, seafood and wine by the Holston River.
photos/33/caption: What we love about our patio is the heavy, supple, comfortable patio furniture.  Of course you'll also love the view and sound of the river and pastoral meadow setting.
photos/34/caption: The covered porch is a godsend on rainy days.  And don't forget about the large outbuilding with ping pong and plenty of sofas for a gallery of judges.
photos/35/caption: One of the problems is wherever you sit, you're looking at somewhere else beautiful.  You'll find yourselves walking everywhere just to absorb some more magic!
photos/36/caption: The sounds of the river totally permeate the covered porch.
photos/37/caption: We always find ourselves solving problems sitting around this heavy glass table surrounded by the sounds of the river.
photos/38/caption: This 8-person Jacuzzi hot tub is one of their flagship models with controls that allow increasing or decreasing jets, colors and currents.  The concrete walk keeps your feet free from debris and the bench make it easy in and out. Float over the river
photos/39/caption: Our storage building is the ultimate man cave.  On rainy days you can solve all the worlds problems right here.
photos/40/caption: Ping pong is fun especially on a quality table.  Open the overhead doors and party the night away.
photos/41/caption: You may own all the tea in China but you'll never know a higher grandeur than lolling above the banks of the South Fork of the Holston River.
photos/42/caption: Our job is to make being by the river easy to enjoy.  So we've got seats galore and unobtrusive safety lights on the river path so you can safely see the edge in the evening.  If you haven't accomplished a thing your whole visit, we've done our job.
photos/43/caption: Stay long enough and you'll begin to notice fine and subtle shades of difference in the time of day by color, sound, scent and sky.  You'll get back in rhythm with nature at the River House.
photos/44/caption: A Cornucopia of natural majesty awaits you at the River House.  Slow down, sit around and just watch people grow.   Get a whole new perspective on life and those you love in a long interlude at the River House.
photos/45/caption: Of the thirty some seats outdoors at the River House, we're sure you'll find your favorite spot.  But we think you'll like em all!
photos/46/caption: Another wonderful sunrise beside the Holston River.  Any direction you look holds sublime wonder and beauty.  From the river to the mountains to the farms, pastures and forests.  Come enjoy all of Southwest VA at the River House, then come back again
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!
sectionedDescription/description:
Natural splendor awaits you at The River House!  Perched on South Fork Holston River, a trout fly fishing mecca, it resonates tranquility.  The home is appointed by the finest in interior furniture and bedding.  Hike, bike, fly fish, tour nearby Mt Rogers, Grayson Highlands, Jefferson National Forest, VA Creeper Trail, or dine in historic Abingdon.  Take in small town vibe at First Friday in Marion.  Enjoy hot tub, ping pong, billiards, croquet, or lolling by the river.  Welcome!  Come enjoy!

The River House is a gorgeous, quiet getaway perched sublimely on the banks of the South Fork of the mighty Holston River in the Adwolfe area of pastoral Smyth County, Virginia.  Nestled peacefully on five hundred feet of this state-hatchery supported trout stream, you’ll find your cares slipping into oblivion regardless of which riverside Adirondack chair or seat in the hot tub you pick.  Here time disappears as your rhythm changes with days dissolving into dusk, sunsets become sunrises and back again.  The sound of the river will resonate in your soul.  Perfectly placed on a private triangle of land, it commands hundreds of feet on the river.  And if you need anything you’re equidistant to Marion or Chilhowie, and even closer to Jefferson National Forest, Mount Rogers, and Grayson Highlands State Park.  

Once you’re acclimated to the serene sounds and sights of this constantly coursing stream, you’ll grow to love the subtle and supple quality of The River House.  Pulling into the driveway you’ll come first to the covered porch with several seating spaces for those times when the rain washes the valley.  Off to the right, along the riverbank is a raised deck, jutting out over the stream.  Further down the bank, are a row of inviting Adirondack chairs.  As I am in this narrative, you’ll find yourself irresistibly drawn to the outside because of its unique, natural power and beauty.  But come inside for a minute.  Let’s cross the threshold.  Here’s a modest but updated kitchen, replete with a coffee bar beside the front door to accommodate company in the kitchen. From the kitchen window you’ll see a wonderful view of the river wending its way north.  Looking left, you’ll see a generous, sunny family room with a café table and six chairs, an exquisite, tufted, Cordovan leather sofa, matching chair, and daybed with trundle for an extra two sleeping berths.  Sink your bare feet into the burgundy wool and silk Persian carpet.  Walk through this sunny space and you’ll enter the hallway to the sleeping quarters.  On the right is the master bedroom appointed with a stout, king-sized furniture suite, another exquisite Persian carpet and carved floral love seat.  Across the hall is the guest bedroom with another compelling queen set.  Our choice of bedding is the Frontgate Resort line.  Linens are from Macy’s Hotel Collection.  Bedding is dried “en plein air,” so you’ll slumber in fragrant mountain sunshine.   We don’t want to anesthetize you, but you’ll love your slumber as much as your waking hours!  

Let’s step down to the lower level and see what’s going on there.  Taking the staircase from the kitchen, we alight on the lower level.  We think you’ll be delighted with the 8’ Brunswick billiards table appointed nicely with a green and buff Tiffany-style billiards light overhead.  Adjacent is an intimate two-chair café table, and wide-screen opposite.  Especially in inclement weather this is another nice and separate gathering space.  We make it easy for folks to converge and diverge. 

Back through the kitchen we come to the large gathering room with full bath.  Quietly dominating this space is a scarlet Bokhara Persian carpet – truly art underfoot.  The generous leather furnishings, glow of the fireplace and overall ambiance may invite you to linger longer than you intended.  In cold weather you’ll love the fireplace radiating warmth and light.  With the spa towels and robes in the nearby armoire, it’s tempting to take a turn in the hot tub.  

Open the patio doors and step out onto the open deck.  Out here you’re going to find your senses beset by a panoply of natural amenities competing for your attention.  You’ll see and hear the unique sounds of the river, the trees waving across green meadows in the wafting wind.  Depending upon how your day has gone, you may just decide to plop down here on the patio to relax and decide what to do next.  That may constitute nothing more than enjoying the experience of the The River House. This open deck is a natural gathering place for sitting, talking, eating and engaging with friends and family surrounded by nature’s bounty and beauty.

Or, grab your towels and robes and head for the spa.  Follow the sidewalk to the Jacuzzi six-person spa with lighting, aqua massage jets for a moment of pure relaxation on the banks of the Holston River letting the water work its wonder.  Others may prefer relaxing on the river-bank in one of the Adirondack chairs.  Recline in these comfy seats and contemplate nothing more than the moving waters.  Or light a campfire in the copper pit or carry a basket of goodies down to the picnic table.  For group lawn games, you can choose between ping-pong, croquet or bocce ball.  You can also access the adjacent storage building with ping pong table and comfortable sofas. 
Here you’ll find three easy-mount bicycles for pure holiday fun.  And if you’d rather hike, we’re happy to provide a trail map to some of the prettier vantage points on our adjacent 240 acres.  You can easily hike 1-5 miles and picnic out in the open with some of Smyth County’s most spectacular views.  Check out our trail maps.  Did we mention trout fishing!  And you can also content yourselves streaming video inside or roaming around outside with our wi-fi music speaker.  Just come have fun!

As you can see, The River House is an experience waiting to unfold beautifully and uniquely for all of our guests.  Hungry Mother State Park, Virginia Highlands Festival, Mount Rogers Naturalist Rally, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, Appalachian Trail - endless opportunities for adventure are just minutes away.  Experience an outdoor adventure or quiet serenity.  Embrace togetherness or seek your own solitude.  However, you choose to personalize your own River House revels, we hope you leave with memories for a lifetime and long to return to do it all over again!  When you return to reacquaint yourselves with its magic, we’ll have everything ready and waiting for you.

Consider renting the river house for a romantic weekend, or a girlfriends only getaway, or a fly fishermen's holiday, or make up your own reason to spend time at the river house.  Maybe the river is calling you!

Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!

Host lives 5 minutes from The River House.  Personal cell number will be shared with confirmed guests upon request.

Adwolfe is a picturesque pastoral valley in the lea of Flat Ridge section of Iron Mountain adjacent historic Mount Rogers.  The valley is dominated by the South Fork of the mighty Holston River, a state hatchery supported trout fishing destination.  The peace and quite may be overwhelming to city dwellers.  The sounds of rippling water over age-old rounded stones, the brilliance of starlight above an open meadow,  the smell of newly mowed hay, the tickle of dew-wet grass between your toes,  the taste of  grilled trout paired with your favorite Sauvignon Blanc...

Where ever your senses carry you, we hope your river house experience will culminate in life-long memories of fun and affection shared with family and friends.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Host lives 5 minutes from The River House.  Personal cell number will be shared with confirmed guests upon request.
sectionedDescription/name: Holston River House - a Sojourn in Serenity...

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite
sectionedDescription/description:
The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite

This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife Elizabeth during the Civil War. Following the war, Colonel Andrew Jackson May (“Jack”) purchased the home. Jack May was thought of as one of Tazewell County’s best known military heroes who played a significant role in the Civil War and helped retain control of the Virginia-Tennessee Railroad. May lived in the mansion with first wife Matilda May, who sadly passed away. Jack remarried Nelle Bly and had a son Colonel May. Nelle remained in the home and turned it into a school for a couple of years before it was sold to the longest owners on record, A.Z. Litz and wife Etta V. Stauber. 

While the mansion has changed ownership over the years, John Warfield Johnston’s home of grandeur remains the same over 160 years later! 

The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite

The Litz Suite pays homage to A.Z. Litz, in which the mansion as we know it today is named. The cozy bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace, and most importantly a private on suite. The on suite is the main attraction here. Newly renovated with beautiful white tile, large glass shower, sunflower shower head and travertine corner seat, make this room a guest favorite. Located downstairs with easy access to the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. Perfect for couples or guests that enjoy a little more privacy.

primaryHost/about: Mother, grandmother, and proprietress of Gather Inn…..author of Pithy Summaries on Amazon, designer of The Quarterly Planner,  and inspired by I Thes. 4:11.
sectionedDescription/access: You're welcome to use the kitchen and laundry room, as well as the library....hopefully making yourself feel at home.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is a large bedroom overlooking Main St with full size bed, desk, and chaise lounge chair. Your private bathroom is in the hall. You're within easy walking distance to the Barter Theatre, VA Creeper Trail, restaurants, Brewery, shops, playgrounds, library, health food store, Farmers Market , and more.  This historic home is in the perfect location and is truly the best way to experience Abingdon.  If your party needs 2nd bedroom, see listing for "two bedrooms upstairs, private hall bath.."

This is a beautiful old home in the heart of the historic district of Abingdon.

You're welcome to use the kitchen and laundry room, as well as the library....hopefully making yourself feel at home.

Perfect location for walking to shops and restaurants. Close to the Virginia Creeper Trail. Most guests park in front on Main St., but parking is also available in the back.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: - Please advise if children are in the party.  All bedrooms are upstairs.

name: Healing Water Falls
photos/0/caption: Your cabin with your own personal waterfall you can see faintly in the top right back corner of the roof. The private deck faces the falls and as one guest said “where else can you feel like you are in a state park in this rustic setting.”
photos/2/caption: This is the new and improved seating area on the deck. It allows for a pull out ottoman which in turn makes it easier to let the world fall away as the falls lull you into a trance.
photos/3/caption: Healing Water Falls welcomes the weary traveler to pause, breathe, and renew.
photos/4/caption: "This door is what I bought the house for.Interviewer:"I thought it was for the view" Oh I never thought of the view." -Georgia O Keefe. Can I relate!  As soon as I saw the Doorknob I was sold!  I made an offer as soon as I could get my realtor.
photos/5/caption: Enjoy intimate seating for two in this updated dining setting.
photos/6/caption: Welcome weary travelers. Come in and rest a while. Let the Falls renew you.
photos/7/caption: Let the calm sunlight bathe you as you soak in the waters of the Asian tub.
photos/8/caption: Hike to the top of the Falls to look look at all the different views. Each one is certain to amaze.
photos/9/caption: Enjoy the view of the creek below as you soak in the tub.
photos/10/caption: Upon first glance at night, it may seem like a normal vacation rental, but when you wake in the morning your eyes will accept the true beauty of the falls.
photos/11/caption: Morning at the Falls. Awaken to the sun painting a day as the rays warm up the trees.  It may be the same view, but the colors change all day long.
photos/12/caption: When you are walking up to the front door you notice the detail of the Asian inspired screen creating a ladder for the jasmine.
photos/13/caption: The Asian inspired fence with the wintry mix in the background frames natures wonders.
photos/14/caption: Up on the Falls looking back down the hill you can see the house nestled on the side of the mountain.
photos/15/caption: Beautiful green summer entrance leading down to the cottage.
photos/16/caption: Can't you just smell the springtime in the air?  I can't wait!  From this distance you can hear the Falls.
photos/17/caption: Side table in bedroom
photos/18/caption: A view into the shower room. The drain consist of a rock ledge .
photos/19/caption: Surprises await at the kitchen window.
photos/20/caption: A halogen light highlights the Falls at night.  The shadows and stars create magic that you have to see to understand.
photos/21/caption: A Carin marks the walls end and the beginning of the entrance to the walkway.  The sun is setting in the distance.  Another wonderful day has passed at the Falls collecting new memories.
photos/22/caption: A view of the creek outside the bedroom window beckons you to pause and wonder. A twisted spray of Sage lends to the beauty of the rustic antiqued window.  Simple things.
photos/23/caption: A view of the creek below is seen from the inspiration spot at the desk.
photos/24/caption: Magic of the Falls
photos/25/caption: Morning never gets old!
photos/27/caption: Enjoy the sound of rushing water and the soft warm glow of candles. Imagine the weight of your cares drop away.
photos/28/caption: Falls at night with moon in the back
photos/56/caption: Newly acquired church. It is your landmark in the curve to notify you to take the next driveway.
photos/57/caption: Lower section of the creek you can explore.
photos/60/caption: Your view from the king sized bed. The falls are in the distance. You can watch them from the bed.
photos/64/caption: One of the many animals you may see from the deck. This friend sauntered by during a private ceremony on the deck. Never know what you will see.
photos/65/caption: New comfortable sitting spots. Promise it’s the best place in the world to have coffee or tea and read a book.
photos/78/caption: A favorite spot along the creek. Good place for a dip.
photos/82/caption: On occasion I have been known to help with surprises. I could not do this without the help of my very trustworthy cleaning lady.
photos/83/caption: Completely Covid updated welcome board. Recommendations, information and directions. Navigate like a local and take the stress out of getting around.
photos/85/caption: Raku family purchased in Budapest in 2003. Finally had a good place to gather.
photos/86/caption: Was hard to bring in supplies this day and clean but I had newlyweds coming and I could not disappoint!
photos/87/caption: Stone bridge and walkway up to the porch.
photos/88/caption: Florence Hot blast pot bellied stove. Sure to keep you warm if the power goes out.
priceDetails/1/value: $10 per night after the first guest
sectionedDescription/access: A 4x4 or all wheel drive are highly recommended as the driveway is steep and has tight twist and turns. Parking for single car at the bottom of the hill and there is a stone walkway to the side entry.  Guest access the house on the main floor and a code for the door will be given before guest arrive.
sectionedDescription/description:
Artisan home surrounded by 15 acres with private waterfall off the deck.  Looking for WIFI & TV this rental is NOT for you. Looking for healing, inspiration, or reconnection this IS your place. Watch the falls from the comfort of your bed as you wake in the morning or from the soaking tub in the evening. Everyday the flow is different and can change within minutes of rainfall. Come experience the magic and stay in a place one guest swears was built  "by garden gnomes and woodland fairies."

Craftsman build.  Custom interior.  Expect the unexpected. Master has a king bed that has an open view of the waterfall. The room also has a half bath in it.  There are no doors separating master bedroom from the rest of the house.  In the hallway you will find a pot belly stove in working order. I ask guest bring their own wood as of now as I have no way of storing large amounts. There is a shower/ bath room that has its own view of the falls. In the summer months open the screened windows and soak in the tub while listening to the falls.  

The kitchen has everything a modern kitchen would need excluding a gas stove as a propane truck can not manage the drive.  Microwave, coffee pot, toaster, blender, french press, pots and pans. Then there is sugar, coffee, tea, oil and spices for your cooking needs. There is a grill that works off of gas canisters which I do stock.  You will find games, puzzles, journals to read and also write in, and 2 very large and very comfortable sitting chairs to snuggle in.  

Deck is equipped with gas fire pit, and a sofa that pulls out to make a rather large lounging space.  In the basement you will find a full sized refrigerator and washer dryer.  Then down the stairs by the creek are chairs and a fire pit for outdoor wood burning.

A 4x4 or all wheel drive are highly recommended as the driveway is steep and has tight twist and turns. Parking for single car at the bottom of the hill and there is a stone walkway to the side entry.  Guest access the house on the main floor and a code for the door will be given before guest arrive.

I am always reachable for questions but I will not be near the property.

Beautiful rolling hills with pasture and cows surround you as you drive up.

You will want to have a car to get around. The house sits at the bottom of the drive and can be quite difficult in bad weather conditions such as ice and snow.  A 4 x 4 vehicle is recommended or if not all wheel drive. Visitors are welcome to explore the property on foot also.

15 Minutes from New River access. 50 minutes to West Jefferson NC and Grayson Highlands State Park in Virginia. Pilot Mountain NC and Stone Mountain State Park NC are both about 50 minutes away as well. About 25 minute drive to Galax Va.

name: The Cave- 2 Bedroom Cabin- Hatfield McCoy
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Plenty of parking
sectionedDescription/description:
The Cave is the perfect cabin for your family! It sleeps 4 but will accommodate up to 6 people. 2nd bedroom includes 12 inch pillow top Queen bed . (1) Three-quarter bathroom includes shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Master bedroom has a 12 inch full size bed. (2) Master bathroom access from the master bedroom. All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths and firewood for fire pit included. Privacy fence on premises.

Welcome to your home away from home! We’re committed to your comfort and adventure.

We are located with access to the Hatfield & McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. You can ride your ATV/SXS directly to the trails from our cabins! Whether you come to ride the trails, hiking, fishing, hunting or a romantic getaway; this is your home away from home!

The Cave cabin sleeps 4 but will accommodate up to 6 people. 2nd bedroom includes 12 inch pillow top Queen bed. (1) Three-quarter bathroom includes shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Master bedroom has a 12 inch full size Gel-Infused green tea memory foam mattress with cooling gel foam bed. (2) Master bathroom access from the master bedroom with shower, toilet, sink and towel rack. There is room for an air mattress and / or sleeping bags in the living area. The couch has 2 recliners that lay all the way back to relax while watching movies. Living room with 42” Smart TV with Netflix, an eat-in full-size Kitchen with stove, sink, microwave, Keurig coffee maker and refrigerator. Heat/ A/C mini split unit, Free Wi-Fi. Fire pit, picnic table on large back porch and outdoor charcoal grills on premises.

All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths, grilling utensils, kitchen cookware (larger cabin), toilet paper, paper towels, firewood for the firepit are all included at no additional cost. Our cabins and cottages can be rented as a group, family or vacation getaway!

Plenty of parking

We will be available to you if you need anything during your stay! We are only a phone call away!

We have plenty of parking. If you’re coming to ride the Hatfield & McCoy trails there is no need to trailer your SXS or UTV. You can ride directly to the trails from the cabin.
