additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Coaldale Condo
photos/4/caption: Large patio firepit, grill, tables chairs.
photos/13/caption: Bathroom
photos/14/caption: Bathroom
photos/15/caption: FWH front veiw
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.
sectionedDescription/interaction: When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.
sectionedDescription/name: Coaldale Condo
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.
sectionedDescription/notes: Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/space:
This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.
sectionedDescription/transit: Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

name: Morningside Farmhouse and Meadows, No Pet Fees
photos/0/caption: Beautiful Morningside 1900 Farm House with amazing views.
photos/1/caption: Sit on the front porch with your morning coffee, take in the views and enjoy the morning breeze.
photos/2/caption: Path thru the Meadow above Morningside, looking West, close of day.
photos/3/caption:
The valleys in Elk Creek are so beautiful!
 And you are right in the middle of it all!
We’ve mown paths thru all the fields for easy walking.
photos/4/caption: Happy dog fetching ball at Green Meadow Pond, on the farm!
photos/7/caption: Loki the good dog, on the front porch, 7/1/23.
photos/8/caption: Looking at Morningside from the West.
photos/12/caption: Wash basin and mirror in the outdoor shower
photos/13/caption: The quiet ambience of Morningside.
photos/14/caption: Nature’s beauty in every direction.
photos/15/caption: You will be embraced by art.
photos/16/caption: Easy walking thru crisscrossing mown paths.
photos/17/caption: Green Meadow Pond — perhaps the prettiest pasture in Virginia,  and part of the farm, 5 minutes from Morningside.
photos/18/caption: A piece of the quiet life.
photos/19/caption: Bring your dogs to Morningside!
photos/20/caption: The foyer.
photos/21/caption: The country kitchen maintains its charm but is fully equipped for big dinners!
photos/22/caption: The kitchen with island and old fashion hutch.
photos/23/caption: Morningside magic.
photos/24/caption: The hall bathroom with tub shower.
photos/25/caption: The downstairs bedroom with double bed.
photos/26/caption: The twin bed is located off the downstairs bedroom, now with table and lamp for office space.
photos/27/caption: Another view of one of the upstairs bedrooms.
photos/28/caption: One of the upstairs bedrooms with double bed.
photos/29/caption: Upstairs bedroom with double bed and twin bed.
photos/30/caption: Bring your paints, have a picnic, run through the fields, or just breathe!
photos/31/caption: Long views of the countryside will take your breath away!
photos/32/caption: Hale Lake at Comers Rock is a peaceful lake on top of the ridge that is well worth the trip.  There is an easy hiking path around the lake. A must see!  Only 15 min from the Farmhouse.
photos/34/caption: Sunlit back  porch with table for 4.
photos/35/caption: Cozy back porch off the kitchen.
photos/37/caption: View from our house down toward Morningside, which is the little white spec in the center middle ground.
photos/40/caption: Living room with table for games and puzzles.
photos/42/caption: Secluded Morningside, in the middle distance.
photos/43/caption: Farm pond, and beautiful meadow that dogs live!
photos/46/caption:
Green Meadow Pond, 5 minutes from the house, 22 acres of beautiful meadow and forest, with forest trail. 

Take Victory Lane, across from driveway, then left on Gem Stream, go 1.5m, see Round Mt Rd on right.   Park.
photos/47/caption: Where dogs and people are happy.
primaryHost/about: I am a  Family Practice doc,  city boy turned country, and art and dog lover.   My wife Theresa and I live in Elk Creek, VA on the family farm.   We have three grown children, boys, and three grandchildren, so far, and at present two happy dogs.
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests are welcome to roam the acreage around the house, as well the surrounding fields and woods of the farm.    In July 2021 we added 22 acres of meadow, forest, and Green Meadow Pond, just a five minute drive from the farmhouse, which is open to your use.  It’s so pretty!!   Good dog swimming!   Fully fenced now.  

The farm has great dog walking, and some of the pastures are fully fenced, if your pooch normally needs a leash but you want to let him run;  just ask and I’ll tell you the details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Beautiful 1900  family farmhouse with lots of breathing room!  This amazing no pet fee dog friendly piece of heaven is 14 secluded acres on the eastern edge of our farm, founded in 1760. Beautiful meadows, forest, springs, creek and pond.  Pet friendly.  We love doggy visitors!  Hike all over  the farm, nearly 200 acres,  and surrounding area.     Enjoy the fire pit. 

Have a really large group?   Add Sunrise Cottage and Meadows, also on the farm.   Or Middleside Farmhouse, likewise on the farm.

This property has a  special meaning to us.  After being in the family about 140 years it was given as a wedding presents by my wife’s great grandfather Chrisman Stone to his daughter Carrie and her husband Glen Ward, and they built Morningside in 1900.    At their death the house and property fell out of the family for about 60 years but now 120 years after its construction it’s back,  after a year’s restoration. 

Mornngside is welcoming new friends and visitors to its tall ceilinged rooms, dark starry nights, and verdant fields.

Enjoy the comforts and quirks of a county farmhouse!

If you are in need of more space, for a bigger group, ck our Sunrise Cottage and Meadows, also on our farm, available to rent independently from Morningside.   Likewise, Middleside Farmhouse and Meadows, also on the farm. 

This is a century-old farmhouse surrounded by hundreds  of acres of open countryside.   We love visitors.  But not every single one of them is welcome!   Try as we might, we cannot keep out every errant wasp, bee, mouse, or stinkbug seeking food and shelter.  Thx for understanding!

Please bring your own bar soap and shampoo. 

What’s more, if you come in the very cold weather months, don’t expect a toasty 75 degrees throughout the house.    This is a 1900 vintage farmhouse without central heat.     Strong monitor heaters keep the central house warm, and radiant heaters scattered about do likewise, but if you’re used to Florida winters, this house will probably disappoint you on a bitter cold November or December day — what is perfectly fine for us may cold be for you.

Green Meadow Pond is fully fenced and available for your use, a great place for a dog swim, and exploring the fields and forest, but there is no fishing.

Guests are welcome to roam the acreage around the house, as well the surrounding fields and woods of the farm.    In July 2021 we added 22 acres of meadow, forest, and Green Meadow Pond, just a five minute drive from the farmhouse, which is open to your use.  It’s so pretty!!   Good dog swimming!   Fully fenced now.  

The farm has great dog walking, and some of the pastures are fully fenced, if your pooch normally needs a leash but you want to let him run;  just ask and I’ll tell you the details.

We are available by phone/ text if you need assistance.   Our house is just up and over the fields; you’ll see colorful flags on the fence row beside the house, and a sign for Stonefarm at the driveway.

There are many things to do around the area:
Comers Rock(Old fire tower look out)  and Hale Lake (with hiking trail)
Hiking at Grayson Highlands State Park
New River Biking Trail in Galax, VA
New River kayaking
Blue Ridge Music Center on the Blue Ridge Parkway
Shopping in nearby Independence Wytheville, and Galax 
Changing of the leaves in autumn
Crooked Road Music Trail
Blue Ridge Parkway
Home of the Old Time Fiddlers Convention in Galax
Fiddlers Convention in Elk Creek
Smoke on the Mountain BBQ cook off in Galax
Mountain Foliage Festival and Grand Privy Races in      Independence in mid-Oct.
July 4th parade and festival.
Chestnut Creek School of the Arts in Galax, VA

It’s easy to wonderfully lost on country back roads if you head out for a wandering spin — the scenery down Comers Rock Road alone is gorgeous — but most lanes will bring you back where you started eventually.

The house is fully air conditioned, tho you can also shut off the AC and open windows and let in the fresh breezes, with the help if you like of window box fans at night, when the temperature always drops beautifully.   The  mountains here stay a full ten to 15 degrees cooler than DC, Charlotte, Winston, and Charlottesville. 

It can be gloriously chilly some Summer mornings.

There are a variety of bed  sizes, but all are full or twin beds which may not be big enough for all guests. 

No secondary booking, meaning no booking for someone else’s use.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: No smoking in the house.

primaryHost/about: Hi, we are Kathy and Rick. Natives of Abingdon Va. Kathy being in education and now following her dream of offering quality lodging to our special guest. Rick made a career in hospitality and real estate.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: We encourage you to enjoy all of this home and be respectful of a landmark property.
sectionedDescription/description:
A comfy cabin adjoining the Va Creeper Trail. This small romantic cabin is a jewel loaded with architectural details, charm and charter. 
A perfect get-a-way for any special occasion, you will love everything about this place.

This is the cabin you always wanted! With a long history of hospitality our goal is to make You feel right at home. This small romantic cabin 
adjoins the Virginia Creeper Trail and is perfect for hiking, biking, fishing and nature viewing.  But this is just the beginning... Being only minutes from Historic Abingdon’s Barter Theatre, Galleries,  Eateries, Shopping, Festivals,  Entertainment and South Holston Lake allows you much more.
Also, a short drive and you are in Bristol Va/Tenn. Birthplace of Country Music and Bristol Speedway.

We encourage you to enjoy all of this home and be respectful of a landmark property.

With a long history of hospitality we provide a wonderful lodging experience and respect your privacy. If needed we are a phone call away.

Adjoining the Va Creeper Trail this awesome property is perfect for hiking, biking, fishing and site seeing. However, you will be tempted to just chill on the wrap around covered porch and enjoy nature and incredible sunsets.
This sanctuary is located only minutes to Historic Abingdon’s Barter Theatre, Martha Washington Inn, William King Art Museum, Shopping Districts, Eateries and South Holston Lake.
Also, 17 miles to Bristol. Birthplace of Country Music and Bristol Motor Speedway.

Private driveway.

Bring a smile and great expectations.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: note: property is serviced by filtered well water.

primaryHost/about: Riversong Retreat is our former vacation home. We love the area so much that we built our forever home nearby after retiring.  In May of 2023 we opened our 2nd rental-the Red Barn Guest House.  Sharlene and I love being outdoors and on the Virginia Creeper Trail or the South Fork of  Holston River. We love being able to walk out the back door to hike, bike or play in the river without having to drive anywhere.  We enjoy hosting!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to the entire house with the exception of one garage bay (our storage area) and approximately 2.5 acres which includes private river frontage and Creeper Trail frontage.
sectionedDescription/description:
NO CLEANING FEE.  Riversong Retreat (owned and operated by the former owners of Riversong Farm) is directly on the Virginia Creeper Trail and the South Holston River.  Walk out the back door for a bike ride or walk on the one of the most beautiful rail to trail routes in the entire country.  Sit by the river and relax or enjoy a campfire.  Visit Damascus or Abingdon and see all the wonderful things offered in these unique towns in the Virginia Highlands.

The main living area is upstairs and the porch overlooks the Creeper Trail and river.  One bedroom and bath is downstairs and is accessed through the garage or lower porch only.  Use one of our garage bays to store your gear or extra food in our second refrigerator.  The upper porch is insulated and will maintain a comfortable temperature if windows are kept closed.  The lower porch is open and also overlooks the trail and river.  The property is approximately 2.5 acres so you will have lots of privacy.

Guests have access to the entire house with the exception of one garage bay (our storage area) and approximately 2.5 acres which includes private river frontage and Creeper Trail frontage.

We live nearby if you need anything and the property has an electronic lock for easy access.

This property is located about halfway between Abingdon and Damascus.

Both Damascus and Abingdon are a short drive (6-7 miles) if you need to find grocery stores or restaurants.  Damascus has many bike rental shops.

We pride ourselves on providing a super clean well stocked rental.  All you need to bring is your food and personal items.  Laundry detergent, paper towels (2 rolls) toilet paper, soap, shampoo, coffee, cleaning supplies, crockpot, mixer, blender, two refrigerators, two washers and dryers are all available for your stay.  We leave extra towels so you won’t have to spend all your time doing laundry.

sectionedDescription/access:
The apartment above the barn.
 *NO ACCESS TO THE BARN*
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the peacefulness and unwind in this rustic barn with amazing views of town, while being away from the noise and hustle of downtown Lebanon Virginia. This unit is 3 miles from the town limits. Perfect for weekend getaways, race weekend in Bristol, and mountain views you can’t get from a hotel. Not handicap accessible, stairs are required for entry to apartment. No WiFi.

Nearby;

Clinch river 
Tank hollow falls (Cleveland Va)
Creeper trail (Abingdon Va)
Bristol motor speedway (Bristol Va)

Unique apartment above the barn with spectacular views, very quiet. Stainless appliances, granite countertops, beautiful wooden furnishings.

The apartment above the barn.
 *NO ACCESS TO THE BARN*

Spectacular sunsets, no neighborhood noise, abundant wild life to view, mountain views.

Best way to get around is your own vehicle as is there isn’t any Uber/taxi/etc.

St. Paul Va (21 miles)
Abingdon Va (24 miles)

There is no wifi, but cell service is good!

name: The Nest: riverfront spot Garrett Creek Clubhouse
primaryHost/about:
I love LOVE.  My favorite quote is from our first president George Washington 

“My first wish is to see the whole world in peace, and the Inhabitants of it as one band of brothers(sisters)striving who should contribute most to the happiness of mankind. “

I teach yoga. I take care of my sphere of influence to the best of my ability. I look through eyes that love, that hope and Believe.
sectionedDescription/access: Your space is private but next to other private spaces. You may run into others outside, but your bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, screened in porch is all yours during your stay.
sectionedDescription/description:
The best that southwest Va has to offer all in one spot. This full bed suite at Garrett Creek Clubhouse is a perfect getaway for a couple wanting to enjoy the natural beauty of our Appalachian mountains and the historic town of Abingdon Va. Watch the North Fork roll by as you swing in the chairs on the screened in porch. Cook up all your favorites in the full size well equipped kitchen. For extra charge have a yoga session in home studio, float tubes or paddle kayaks  in the river with stay.

The space has stairs. After you park in front of red shed, walk up the concrete and wooden stairs to the left of property and enter the code on the door keypad. Turn the whole knob to the left to unlock.

Your space is private but next to other private spaces. You may run into others outside, but your bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, screened in porch is all yours during your stay.

I am a “here if you need me” host. Call my cell, shoot a message in AirBnB. Otherwise enjoy your private life and I will enjoy mine. 276-698-5381

The river will tell you it’s mood. If it’s muddy best to stay out, if it’s easy to see the rocks and a beautiful day you are welcome. But it’s a wild river with no guarantees of safety at all. Please be smart: Wear water shoes, wear sun screen, don’t go in if you’re not sober and a healthy strong swimmer. 
The house behind GCC is abandoned and dangerous do not trespass please.

The Nest is the first right off Garrett Creek Road. Turn in at the concrete drive and park in front of the little red shed. Pull straight ahead to exit via the gravel drive.

If you see a couple of dogs, they are the neighbors “Hokie” and “Brownie” do not encourage their visiting in any way please. Feel free to say “Go home!” as commandingly as you are comfortable.
sectionedDescription/interaction: I am a “here if you need me” host. Call my cell, shoot a message in AirBnB. Otherwise enjoy your private life and I will enjoy mine. 276-698-5381

sectionedDescription/description:
Nestled in the Appalachian Mountains, this newly renovated (2021) A Frame cabin runs off solar power but offers all the modern amenities.  Sitting on over 300 acres of land, you will find complete relaxation of not having a neighbor in sight.  However, you may encounter plenty of wildlife including cows, deer, wild turkey and our friendly farm horse named "Rowdy Boy".  The cabin is very secluded and is the perfect spot to get away from it all.  Please scan our QRCode for more information.

Perfect for couples.

The A-frame is very secluded. We are nestled away in the mountains in rural southwest Virginia.

name: Hungry Mother Island. A unique cabin retreat.
primaryHost/about: My husband and I enjoying traveling around the world. We reside in southwestern Virginia and also enjoy spending time at the properties we share with you. We enjoy the outdoors especially spending time on the ski slopes!  I prefer clean, non-smoking, and unique places to stay and share the same with you.
sectionedDescription/access: Access to the cabin thru the park area is free. Guest can use any of the state park area for a small daily fee payable at the front gate.
sectionedDescription/description:
Hungry Mother Island is a unique three bedroom cabin on its own island surrounded by Hungry Mother Creek at Hungry Mother State Park in Marion, VA.  Located off the Back of the Dragon Trail &  bordered by Hungry Mother State Park along with George Washington & Jefferson National Forest.  Nearby multiple wilderness areas, superb mountain stream fishing, small lake fishing, swimming area & beach, wildlife management areas & miles of trails offer tons of natural amenities and outdoor opportunities.

Your own island!
Yes, this unique property 'Hungry Mother Island' offers the chance to stay surrounded by water on your own little island on Hungry Mother Creek at Hungry Mother State Park. This newly remodeled cabin offers three bedrooms (Max 6 occupancy on property) and two bathrooms with a jacuzzi tub in the downstairs bath. Eat in kitchen for four with stainless appliances, wood slab bar top and butcher block counter tops. Or have the entire family sit down to dinner around the interesting dining room table, all while seeing the creek flow by out of every window. Unwind on the sectional sofa in front of the stone fireplace while streaming your favorite show on the 60" TV. Relax on the rooftop patio or entertain under the lights on the stone patio while grilling out on the large stone fire/charcoal grill. The whole place is yours other than a couple of closet spaces and small areas we use for storage.

Access to the cabin thru the park area is free. Guest can use any of the state park area for a small daily fee payable at the front gate.

Will have someone available only if necessary.

https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.usatoday.com/amp/725633002

Free parking in our packed gravel circle driveway.

This is a mid-century modern-rustic cabin that has been recently updated. Please note a few things about the property’s access and safety. The cabin is completely surrounded by water (unless it’s a dry season). Access to the cabin is via a small walk bridge. Guest will have to carry their belongings about 15 yards (small cart provided) across the bridge. Though the surrounding water is pretty shallow, don't allow children to be unattended, they can drown! The upstairs bedroom access is via a spiral staircase and not elderly, handicapped or child friendly. The upstairs patio has dated hand rails and does not provide child friendly safety railing. We welcome all guests no matter age or condition, but just want our guest to know what to plan for. There is an additional fee for more than 4 people and a maximum total of 6 people allowed. Due to the unique location of the house and the fragile waste water system; please note that there is a strict 6 person limit for our property. Unless prior arrangements have been made, in writing, guest exceeding this limit will be financially responsible for the cost to have the system pumped and serviced, plus additional cleaning fees, extra person fees and any damages or fees associated with ignoring the rules of our property. Misrepresentation of actual number of guests just to avoid the extra person fee will also incur additional cleaning fees, extra person fees and any damages or fees associated with ignoring the rules of our property. Please note we have a no pet policy. All additional costs shall be billed through Airbnb and any fees they charge may apply. By checking in to our property, guests accept these rules and the responsibilities listed above. If you do not accept and wish to cancel, you may do so within the cancellation period and receive a refund.  Thanks for your understanding as we only want to be able to share and enjoy our property for many years to come.

In addition, we have the privilege of offering you the opportunity to schedule a massage during your getaway.  A local massage therapist can travel to the cabin to offer massage therapy at your convenience.  Message us for details.

primaryHost/about: My families connection with this mountain goes back 40 years and we are so excited to share its breathtaking beauty with you!
sectionedDescription/access: The cabin is easily accessible by most cars  and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.
sectionedDescription/description:
Retreat to the serenity of this newly renovated, sustainable getaway and enjoy the natural beauty of the area. Lucky Bear is a rustic cabin that rests on a scenic hiking trail on Brumley Mountain. A welcome and calming paradise for those who love nature, you will fall in love with its charm and open floor plan. With each stay fresh towels and linens are furnished.

Before you make your Reservation 
MAKE SURE YOUR GUEST COUNT IS CORRECT.           

Welcome to your stay at the Channels Retreat . This is a perfect place for hikers or a relaxing getaway.

Situated  along The Brumley Mountain Trail and bordering the Channels State Forest, This picturesque 4 acre meadow is home to a newly remodeled off grid, solar-powered studio cabin featuring a queen bed ,full bath and with additional loft featuring 1 full size bed.

The loft area has low clearance sloped ceilings but can still comfortably sleep adults.

Well appointed kitchen is fully stocked with all the necessities you need to cook your meals such as pots, pans and silverware. It features a gas stove with oven. 

Water is provided via well with filtration system that includes UV light for excellent purification. 

Cabin is heated by a gas log stove unit.

Outside of the cabin, there is a huge covered front porch and a dining table and 2 rockers to relax in, just off the porch, a picnic table and a gas grill.

While the cabin's address is listed as being in Saltville VA, the property is actually located in Washington County and is closer to the Abingdon VA area on Hayter's Gap Road 
Rt. 80.

For more information go to channelsretreat .com

The cabin is easily accessible by most cars  and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.

We look forward to having you and are available should you have any questions during your stay. Feel free to contact me at any time with any questions or concerns that you may have.
Please reach out to me at least an hour before your arrival so that I can give you your key code, and answer any questions you may have.

Sit under the stars by night and under the magnificent canopy of shade trees by day.

Clinch Mountain is home to beautiful plant life and undergrowth, while a variety of deciduous trees form a towering canopy above.

 It is truly a birdwatcher and botanist paradise. 

Location is right on the trail leading to Channels  and is the last privately owned parcel upon entering channels state forest And natural preserve
﻿
The Great Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating ecosystems. It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a firetower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

The hike is a hidden gem in southwest Virginia and you will find nothing else in Virginia quite like it. 
For the more adventurous hiker, the hike can continue on to Hidden Valley Lake (14 mile hike).

The road that leads to the cabin is off of the route 80 trailhead. At the Russell Washington county line. The Gravel road leading to the cabins is Shared with the hiking trail leading to the Channels

Step right outside of the front door at The Channels Retreat cabins and you will be greeted to the trail That travels to the great Channels of Virginia. The trail crosses over the front of the property

The Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating  ecosystems.

It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate and often hold snow cover long after temperatures have risen above freezing. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

STANDARD CHECK IN TIME 3PM .
CHECK OUT TIME 11AM.

sectionedDescription/access:
Enjoy the privacy of an entire two bedroom, one bath apartment that is dedicated solely to guest use. It’s located on the second floor above a furniture store. ***Must climb stairs***

There’s no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.  The apartment is also secured with a locking exterior door.
sectionedDescription/description:
* If you book for 7 days or more, you will receive a 20% discount off your stay.  

If you’re in town on business, to visit family or just traveling through, this 2ND FLOOR APT is perfect for you.  Enjoy a full kitchen & onsite laundry facility.   You’ll get a good nights sleep in a quiet space, on high quality mattresses. We are conveniently located just down the street from a Food City. We have a work desk & free WIFI. We’re just a 5 minute drive from downtown Pikeville.

Family oriented or perfect for the business traveler!  This apartment is spacious, clean, and conveniently located.

Enjoy the privacy of an entire two bedroom, one bath apartment that is dedicated solely to guest use. It’s located on the second floor above a furniture store. ***Must climb stairs***

There’s no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.  The apartment is also secured with a locking exterior door.

I am available via email at dreamfurniture@aol.com.

The apartment is conveniently located in the Indian Hills community in Pikeville.  Food City is conveniently located just down the street approximately 0.2 miles, for any necessities you may need. We’re only a 5-7 minute drive from downtown.

Parking is available in the lot to the left or the lot to the right of the building. You can access the apartment on either side of the building. There is a flight of outdoor stairs on each side of the building to access the apartment which is located on the second floor.

There’s no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.  The apartment is also secured with a locking exterior door.

additionalHouseRules:
Quite hours after 10 pm.
No trespassing on adjoining properties
No smoking, additional fees will apply for odor removal.
Caution with children-steep hillside on back of property drops off to the river.  The woods are full of poison ivy so please avoid the woods. 

Please do not wash pots and pans in dishwasher it will ruin them - they are not dishwasher friendly.  And please do not mix things with a mixer in the pots and pans - it will ruin them - only mentioned this because it had become a common occurrence and ruined several sets of pots and pans and they are not cheap. There will be charges for damaged pots and pans in the future. 
Any request for date changes must be submitted at least 30 days in advance to allow us time to get the cabin rebooked.  If 30 days advance notice is not given - date changes will be denied . Sorry for the inconvenience but we have had a lot of last minute changes and it does not  allow us time to rebook. Thank you for your understanding.

name: The Cottage at Willow Tree Retreat
sectionedDescription/description:
Looking for an affordable vacation getaway.   The Cottage at Willow Tree Retreat is a quaint small bungalow in a peaceful quite area close to the town of Damascus. The cottage is located less than 1 mile to the award winning Virginia Creeper Trail and and a short drive to Grayson Highlands State Park where the wild ponies roam.

Wifi code on the refrigerator or in the green folder.  

Please do not dispose of sanitary napkins in the toilet or paper towels.   Having to hire a plumber to come will incur additional cost if related to improper disposal in the toilets.

Smoking of any kind in the house is strictly prohibited and will result in a hefty fee to have odors removed. 

Woods around the property are mostly on adjoining neighbors property - No trespassing - they have cameras. Also woods are full of thorns and poison ivy. 
You are in the county you might see snakes, deer, rabbits, ants, spiders and very small possibility you may encounter other dangerous animals such as bear or coyote. 
Please call us day or night with any major issues, water leaks anything of that sort.

sectionedDescription/access: Whole cabin
sectionedDescription/description:
This cozy little cabin is the closest lodge to Braveheart and Rockhouse Trailheads. Located on the Guyandotte river, park your rig and ride your ATV’s anywhere.
Located in a quiet, peaceful community, you will see kids riding their bicycles, duck and geese in the backyard and a puppy or two needing a belly rub! Great folks to welcome you to Hatfield Mcoy trails! Try us once, you’ll be back!

Whole cabin

We are available 24/7 and always close by. As little or as much interaction as you wish!

Less than 1 mile to Rockhouse Trailhead and Braveheart Trailhead. Town of Man, food, nightlife, grocery store, Hardee’s, Wendy’s, Fuel, Dollar General, Ice cream and more!

Park your trailer and ride your machines anywhere!!!

Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Iron Horse"
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just below this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or the owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Iron Horse is named and themed (décor) after Sergeant Brandon Asbury, United Stated Army.  Sgt. Asbury was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate of Tazewell High School. The cabin was decorated in conjunction with his family to reflect his life and to honor his sacrifice.  It is only meant to remember him and the price our service members pay for our freedom. It is also to teach about the history of Tazewell County, VA.

name: Private getaway in downtown Abingdon
primaryHost/about: Adventuring through life. We use Airbnb for most of our trips, traveling with our kids or on getaways. Always choosing happiness and now enjoying hosting our own place to pass on the beauty of this community.
sectionedDescription/access: You have the whole apartment to yourself, along with a small yard and patio for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is an apartment with a private entrance in downtown Abingdon. Within walking distance to restaurants, The Creeper Trail, Main st., Barter theatre and all Abingdon has to offer! You have your own private patio and yard. Pet friendly for your perfect weekend visit to Abingdon and all it has to offer. We offer smart TV, Wifi, washer/dryer and fully stocked kitchen. With bright decor, this is a darling cozy spot for your stay.

This is a private apartment in a small apartment building right in Downtown Abingdon. You have your own private entrance. Parking available right in front of your door on the street. The patio has seating with a small yard. We provide everything you need for a comfortable and private get away! Pets are welcome. There is a $35 pet fee per pet that we will charge via Airbnb on day of arrival. This is a fully furnished unit. Smart TV in the bedroom and the living room.

You have the whole apartment to yourself, along with a small yard and patio for you to enjoy.

Right on Valley St. This is a perfect location. Walking distance to the heart of Abingdon. And beautiful streets to walk/run if that’s what you would like! Don’t forget to stop at our famous Abingdon Farmers Market. It usually runs Saturdays and Tuesday afternoons in the summer. You can walk to Barter Theatre, Restaurants and antique stores all along Main st. This is a very safe street and neighborhood in downtown Abingdon.

Bikes. Walking. And of course a car :) Virginia Creeper Trial Bike Shop is located in town and offers bike rentals.

We will provide a grill for your enjoyment during the summer months. This has an efficient heat and air mini split system. Please read our Abingdon guide book for great recommendations on restaurants and things to do during your stay! There is a $35 pet fee per pet that will be charged to you via Airbnb on the day of arrival. There is a washer and dryer along with extra bedding if needed. The couch is a comfortable full size couch able to sleep one person. Parking is available on the street in front of the building or beside the building.

primaryHost/about: I am a realtor from coastal NC. I love traveling and do so often!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill
sectionedDescription/description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. The Tin Roof is located near the Hatfield McCoy trails where you have multiple trailheads to choose from. No need to load your trailer, ride your ATV directly from this location. Tin Roof is 37 miles from Winterplace for the ski bunnies!  Multiple lakes for a day in the kayak , hiking trails to get in your steps , and several restaurants to enjoy;  all located close by! Two living rooms and plenty of space!

Three trucks and Three trailers ( depending on length) will fit in driveway. All three bedrooms have large beds and room for all your gear! Two living rooms  2 Tv’s and plenty of eating space at the kitchen island or dining table. A full laundry room, front  deck with outdoor eating area, and a fire pit in the backyard for evening relaxing!  For your convenience there is a permanent charcoal grill. The Keurig and crockpot are a few of the extra additions to the kitchen that will make your stay easy!  Basic cable in the living room and smart TV in the den . Brand new mattresses , furniture installed September 2021.  Towels , Hand Towels , washcloths, and all bed linens included.  Fully stocked kitchen with dishes , cups , and cooking utensils.

Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill

Fee free to message with any questions or suggestions!

Tin Roof is located in an ATV friendly town where you can drive your ATV to restaurants , gas stations and trailheads.  Located minutes from Various trail heads as well as restaurants. We are also near Bluefield University and a short trip to the VA line . As well as a short drive to a nearby airport.

While public transportation may be sparse, vehicles, ATV’s and hiking are no issues to get around.

This property is adjacent to  a main road HWY 52, and less than a mile from Lorton Lick rd, we also live off a small quiet road. We ask that you respect our neighbors and refrain from parties or disruptive behavior. You can access HWY 52 from our front yard with an atv , please stay to the left of the rock/boulders which mark our property line. Toilet paper , paper towels , shampoo and soap are provided. Coffee , sugar and honey for your first morning will also be available . Laundry detergent, dish detergent, and sponges. Ready for your arrival !

primaryHost/about:
I have been in professional vacation rental management for 20 years - and before that the hotel industry.  I am formerly from Bluefield WV and this home sits on my family farm.  Materials for the home was farmed from the surrounding property, milled on my fathers sawmill and loving crafted.  The hard wood floors were reclaimed from an old local store from the early 1900's.  

I love to travel and when I do I look for the places where I can live like a local.  I want to step back, meet the people, eat the food and see what it really means to live "there".  

This home is nothing fancy.  If you are looking for upscale accommodations - this is not it.  This is my country retreat - a place I go to sit on the porch, listen to the frogs, build a fire outside or take a walk in the woods.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back to the Heart of Appalachia on a farm that has been in my family for the last 75 years.  Sitting on 40 acres, convenient to the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System (8 miles away ) - this property allows you to enjoy the mountains without roughing it!

Enjoy horse shoes, corn hole, volleyball and hiking during your visit.  A propane grill is available for your use on the large back deck.  This property has been home to three generations of farmers who have loved the land and all it provided.  In the 1940's moonshine was still rampantly produced in Appalachia and this property was the site of several family still operations.  This home sits just 250 ft off the main roadway.

I will be available by phone for emergencies.  There is a caretaker that lives next door to the property and can assist in an emergency.

This location is very rural residential.  Although you have access to roam the recommended trails - please use caution as this is Appalachian woodlands.   Please do not cut any trees on property.  Firewood is provided for use in the outdoor fire pit.

No ATV riding is allowed on the property.  Trails are available to hikers and mountain bikers only.

You can drive an ATV along the shoulder of a highway or road for up to 10 miles at a speed of 25 miles per hour or less.  There is trail access within 8 miles of the property so you may park your trailers and ride the ATV to the trail head from this property.

You will have access to a fully equipped kitchen.  A regular coffee maker as well as a Keurig is available for your use.  There are TV's in the living room and Master bedroom.  These TV's are not cable enabled.  Wi-Fi is available.  Please note that the property does not have municipal water service - water is furnished by a well.  Air conditioning is available in all bedrooms.

Guests may have up additional visitors (not overnight). Please use caution with outdoor Firepit - do NOT leave embers burning. All fire pit embers must be extinguished and not left unattended.  Indoor fireplace is gas logs only.  Please park in the designated parking only.  Do not drive or park in the yard.  Absolutely no smoking inside of the house.  You are welcome to smoke outside but please dispose of butts properly - not in the yard.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Sui
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Suite

Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.
sectionedDescription/summary:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

sectionedDescription/access:
Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a quiet country setting just 10 minutes from downtown Abingdon and the Virginia Creeper Trail, 20 minutes to the Appalachian Trail, 30 minutes to downtown Bristol.  Enjoy pastoral views while you relax on the back deck, which runs the length of the house.  The unit includes the entire main floor of the home with bedroom, bath, living room, full kitchen and laundry room.  If you love the outdoors this is a great base for exploring this beautiful corner of the world.

The house location offers the best of a country setting with easy access to town, shopping, theater and restaurants.  If you want to do some cooking, you'll find a fully outfitted kitchen or consult our dining guide for a selection of local restaurants.

Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.

I am not at the home but am reachable and nearby in case of any issues.

The house is located a very short distance up a gravel road.  Visitors may park where they wish behind the house or under the on-site carport.

This is the same home that can be reserved under listing 53669707.  The listing you are on sleeps up to four (1 bedroom, 1 sofa bed, 1 full bath) while the other listing sleeps up to eight (2 bedrooms, 2 sofa beds, 2 full baths).  Either way, the property is only rented to one set of guests at a time.

sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family on this peaceful working farm. Enjoy the farm animals and running stream in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains. Tour  the Blue Ridge Parkway or Creeper Trail.   Historic Wythe County, Wohlfahrt Theatre, Abingdon, Barter Theatre, Big Walker Lookout  Shot Tower, Draper Mercantile and so much more. Get unplugged, no distracting internet. Fish in the pond or make smores at the firepit.  Experience the farm with optional homegrown meals/tours. A little piece of heaven.

sectionedDescription/access:
Multiple decks offer plenty of outdoor living space. Guests have access to the entire loft. The barn sits on the same land as our sister property, a two bedroom cottage. Should you need multiple accommodations, please message for details.


https://abnb.me/Ktwf7uKSk3
sectionedDescription/description:
This newly renovated loft atop a genuine barn on 4 acres gives visitors to #SWVA a most unique travel experience only 1000 feet from the Va Creeper Trail. Trip101.com lists it in the top 10 barns in which to stay in VA! Only minutes from downtown Damascus dining and shopping and a bike ride away from the Virginia Creeper Trail, this beautiful space is a getaway you don’t want to miss. With beautiful mountain views from every angle, this is a hiker and cycling enthusiasts dream spot!

This loft offers a newly renovated open concept living and kitchen space with a full bath with tile shower, and a separate bedroom with queen bed.  Amazon Echo Dot available for guests use, play music or get the weather and news!

Multiple decks offer plenty of outdoor living space. Guests have access to the entire loft. The barn sits on the same land as our sister property, a two bedroom cottage. Should you need multiple accommodations, please message for details.


https://abnb.me/Ktwf7uKSk3

We are available by phone/email/message.

Only minutes to Downtown Damascus for dining and shopping, and a few short miles away from historic Abingdon, home of the Barter Theatre, state theatre of Virginia.

The loft is NOT handicap accessible. Guests must be able to go up steps.

Our team now uses a UV wand, in addition to all other cleaning measures, to disinfect high touch surfaces.  We have also equipped the space with a hepa filter to disinfect the air. 

Check out our newest addition in the pics...a picnic area with a fire pit!

sectionedDescription/access: There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.

Ride your machine through town to access the Hatfield McCoy Trail. Access Rockhouse Trail, Devil Anse Trail and Buffalo Mountain Trail. Also, ride your machine into town to eat at one of our many restaurants.

photos/1/caption: Bedroom with king bed,  roomy dresser and two nightstands with drawers

photos/9/caption: Peruse our map of Railroad History Towns -- towns surrounding Bluefield -- while watching trains go by in the distance. Map shows towns with landmarks, restored depots or railroad museums.
photos/10/caption: Spacious back porch is perfect for relaxing or dining
photos/12/caption: Bluefield and nearby towns with railroad museums, restored depots or other landmarks. Bluefield -- at the center of the region's RR history!

photos/16/caption: Parking for the Railroad Express Guest Suite
photos/17/caption: View of Bluefield State from the backyard
photos/18/caption: Not pictured: the railroad tracks are on the other side of Bluefield Avenue -- you can hear the trains.
primaryHost/about: I moved to West Virginia about 15 years ago. I love the beauty of this state with its mountains and rivers. I also love the old houses in Bluefield that were built a century ago to accommodate all those who prospered by working for the railroad, which was essential to the transport of coal. I undertook a major renovation of the home that contains the apartment we call the Railroad Express Guest Suite. The house has good bones and beautiful hardwood floors and was worth the effort!
sectionedDescription/access: Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.

High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.

Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.

Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.

Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.

Both Bluefield, West Virginia, and Bluefield, Virginia, have extensive bus service. The driveway is large enough to accommodate a trailer. 
ATV parking may be arranged off-site.

Contact host for parking instructions and keypad code.
